Adwoa uses her income to help her husband cover food and utility bills. Adwoa will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to save towards further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale

loans.name: Mérida

texts.es: Mérida tiene 45 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y 4 D. sus 6 hijos en su propia casa. Ella es comerciante D. productos según la temporada, por ejemplo; si es navidad, venD. adornos para la ocasión, en este caso, que se aproxima la época escolar se abastece D. útiles escolares al por mayor y los venD. en las zonas rurales cercanas a su localidad, pero que geográficamente son D. difícil acceso, D. esa manera garantiza el ingreso familiar. Este trabajo lo realiza  junto a su esposo, los meses D. bajas ventas son cuando inicia el año, es decir D. enero y febrero, por lo cual Mérida aprovecha la ocasión para criar pollos y venderlos. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, es parte D. un banco comunal, donD. se compromete, nuevamente, a seguir trabajando con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero solicitado es para la compra D.  útiles  escolares al por mayor, invertirá 1800 soles, con el resto D. dinero implementará mejor su granja D. pollos.
texts.en:
Mérida is 45 years old, married and lives with her husband and four of her six children in her own home. She sells seasonal products; for example, at Christmastime she sells Christmas decorations. Now that the school year is approaching, she is stocking up on school supplies, selling them in the rural areas close to where she lives which are difficult to get to, thus ensuring the family income. She works together with her husband. When sales are slow at the beginning of the year, in January and February, Mérida takes advantage of the downtime to raise chickens and sell them. This is her second loan with MFP. She is part of a community bank where she has committed herself again to continue working with great responsibility. She will use the loan to buy s/1,800 Soles worth of school supplies in bulk and the remainder of the loan will be used for her chicken farm.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
S., age 44, lives in a medium-sized traditional wooden house in a rural area of Banteay Meanchey province where she owns a plot of farmland and cultivates rice. She is married and has given birth to four children: one is married and the other three are single. Her husband's name is Em, 49, and he is a local teacher in a primary school.

In the past, S. always hired a cultivating machine from a neighbor to plow her farmland and she currently hopes to own a machine; thus, she would like to request a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a cultivating machine. Owning a machine, she can hire it out to other farmers for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a cultivating machine to use and rent out

loans.name: Benedito Feliciano

texts.pt:
Benedito nasceu em gaza tem 41anos de idade vive maritalmente, estudou ate a 4 classe do antigo sistema devido a falta de condicoes dos seus pais, e pai de 4 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 7meses e 13 anos de idade  os 4 mais velhos e que vao a escola pois o mais novinho e um recem nascido.

Benedito sai de gaza a maputo alegando que ia estudar, chegado a maputo comeca a trabalhar com o seu pai como pedreiro.anos depois muda se com a sua familia para namaacha uma vila na fronteura com swazilandia,comeca a fazer  trabalhos locais como pedreiro, porque trabalho não rende muito em mocambique ele emigra para a africa do sul hoje ele e chefe de obras e trabalha na base de contratos a mais de 10 anos abre uma barraca na sua residencia pois ele trabalha longe de casa e não consegue satisfazer a necessidade da sua familia a tempo e hora e alega que esta e a melhor forma de ajudar a sua esposa enquanto ele estiver ausente, tem visitado a sua familia de 3 em 3 meses.o negocio tem um impacto positivo na comunidade e ele não consegue satisfazer a necessidade dos clientes e aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt para aumentar o stock dos seus produtos, tem como melhor produto a cerveja nacional 2M adquire a caixa por 250 e revende a 330, o saco de arroz 25kg a 500 e revende a 600 tem tido de receita mensal 3.000.00mt e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00mt responsabiliza se pelo seus pais que vivem com ele em sua casa.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
Benedito já teve um emprestimo no banco tsuma e pagou sem nenhuma dificuldade, e este e o primeiro na hluvuku e kiva. Que seram usados para comprar produtos de primeira necessidade para revenda e esta confiante que ira desembolsar cem nenhum problema mesmo que ele se ausente a sua esposa ira pagar.
texts.en:
Benedito was born in Gaza. He is 41 years old and is married. He went to school until the 4th grade in the old system due to the lack of conditions of his parents. He is the father of 4 children with ages between 7 months and 13 years old. The 4 oldest kids go to school, and the youngest is a newborn. Benedito left Gaza for Maputo alleging that he was going to study. Having arrived in Maputo he began to work work with his father as a mason. Years later he moved with his family to Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland. He started doing local work as a mason, but because his work does not pay very well in Mozambique he emigrated to South Africa. Today he is in charge, and he works on a contract base. Over ten years ago he opened a stand in his home. Since he works far from home and is not able to satisfy the needs of his family he thought this was the best way to help his wife while he is away. He has visited his family 3 times in 3 months. His business has a positive impact on the community and he is unable to satisfy the demands of his customers. He approached hluvuku and solicited a loan for 15,000MT to increase his inventory. His best product is beer. He buys a case for 250 and resells it for 330. A 25kg sack of rice costs 500 and is resold for 600. He has had monthly receipts of 3,000MT and is able to save 1,000MT per month. He is also responsible for his parents who live with him in his house. Benedito already had a loan from a bank, and he paid it without difficulty. This is his first with Hluvuku and with Kiva, which he will use to purchase staple products for resale. He is confident that he will be able to pay off this loan without problems. Even if he is absent his wife will pay.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa V. lives with her two children and husband, Arvin V..  She is a 22 years old former "sales lady" in Tagbilaran Bohol.  

Jessa started her seaweed farm using her small savings of Php 5,000.  She is happy that her husband is highly skilled at planting seaweed.  This is how they feed and clothe their family.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI.  Jessa will use the loan to buy seedlings and have their boat repaired.  The loan will definitely help the couple increase the size of their farm and continue their livelihood.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own businesses.  They give all their clients credit, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Buy seedlings and repair boat.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une mère de famille qui a en charge ses 02 enfants ainsi que 5 de ses petits fils. Elle vend sur étal divers produit alimentaire (pate d'arachide , légumes etc) et souhaiterait promouvoir son activité avec ce prêt. Son objectif est de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama D. is the mother of a family and raising 2 of her children as well as 5 of her grandchildren. She has a little display where she sells various foodstuffs (peanut butter, vegetables, etc.) and she would like to reinforce her business with this loan. Her goal is to support her family better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of various foodstuffs

loans.name: Diana Melissa

texts.es: la sra. Diana O. tiene 24 años de edad, ella tiene un local en el mercado los Dolores en Tegucigalpa, ella tiene mas de 6 años de experiencia en este negocio, ella en este momento quiere invertir el dinero para comprar zandalias, ropa interior y pañuelos, tambien comprar mas productos de los que vende para tener mas variedad. estos nuevos productos que quiere vender tienen mucha demanda, muchas mujeres compran zandalias y ropa interior, este tipo de producto se le saca buena gananacia, ella es una mujer soltera y no tiene hijos, ella desea tener una tienda muy grande para poder adquirir una casa y luego tener una familia que ese es su mayor sueño.
texts.en:
Diana O. is 24 years old and has a shop in Tegucigalpa's Dolores Market. She has had her business for more than six years and is requesting a loan to purchase more of the items that she already sells as well as new products, including sandals, underwear, and handkerchiefs. These new items are in great demand, as many women buy sandals and underwear. This type of product also provides a good profit.

Diana is single and does not have any children. Her goal is to have a very large store so that she can buy a house and later start a family, which is her biggest dream.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sandals, underwear, handkerchiefs, necklaces, watches, stickers, erasers, hangers, nail polish, nail polish remover, and nail clippers

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Давлатмуродов Умеджон  проживает в районе Хуросон .Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Работает в пекарне. Выпекает лепешки  и реализует их оптовым покупателям. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 8 лет.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить муку. Это даст возможность увеличить объем производимой продукции и соответственно товарооборот.
texts.en:
Umedjon D. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. He works in a bakery. He makes flat breads and sells them to wholesale buyers. He has been in this business for eight years. Umedjon plans to use the loan to buy flour. This will let him increase the production volume and the turnaround of the product as well.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Juana Guillermina

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Juana es casada tiene 60 años, dos hijos de 28 y 35 años que trabajan y estudian.
Empezó en su casa  hace 15 años vendiendo licores, cervezas, caramelos baratos, todo fue poco a poco tiene su bodega grande ahora  vende  licores de calidad, su tienda esta entre las cinco mejores de la zona de Pachacamac, ella se dedica administrar su tienda.  
Desde que esta en Finca   aprendió a invertir, ahorrar, le gusta las reuniones comparte con sus amigas.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de productos por el día del padre, colonias, relojes y licores. 
El sueño de Juana es que su hija se case y que la salud de ella mejore.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano. She is married; is 60-years-old; and has two children, who are 28 and 35. They go to school and work. She started a business in her house 15 years ago by selling liquor, beer, and cheap candy. She expanded it little by little and today she has a large store where she sells quality liquor. Her store is among the five best in the Pachacamac area, and she manages her store. Since she has worked with Finca, she has learned how to invest and how to save. She likes going to meetings so she can share with her friends. Juana needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to be able to buy merchandise for Father's Day like colognes, watches, and liquor. Juana's dream is to see her daughter get married and that her health improves.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to purchase products for Father's Day like colognes, watches, and liquor.

loans.name: Sear

texts.en:
Sear K., 47, is a widow who lives with her two children in Kampong Cham province. She sells fermented fish and vegetables in the market, making around US$ 2 each day and is supported by one of the children who is a garment factory worker.

Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. Sear K. is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to purchase fermented fish and vegetables to sell. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fermented fish and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de abarrotes, ya son años que se dedica a este tipo de actividad.Estableció su negocio, ahorrando poco a poco, vendiendo  productos de belleza de la línea Esika y Oriflame. Aparte de contar con su negocio, también trabaja como vendedora en una tienda de ropas.Como vemos, Rosita genera sus propios ingresos de diferentes formas, para sacar adelante a su familia. Hoy sus vecinos y amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, todos los días sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, paquetes de leches y aceites; también paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa T. is a member of the Esmeralda Microfinance Institute, located in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martín. She is a 41-year-old woman with a live-in partner and one dependent son. She states that she started out by selling provisions in her general store, a business that she has been managing for several years now. She got started by saving money little by little, selling Esika and Oriflame beauty products. Aside from this business, she also works as a salesperson at a clothing boutique. As we can see, Rosita generates her own income through different jobs in order to help her family get ahead. Her friends and neighbors know her well, and since she is very welcoming, business is booming. With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase goods like: sacks of rice and sugar, crates of milk, cooking oil, crates of soft drinks (different sizes and flavors), household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products. Thus, she can keep her customers satisfied. She feels good about the work that she is doing, and she believes that the sacrifice is worth it because she can reach her life goals and dreams. She would also like to thank the Manuela Ramos Movement for giving support to her and to other women who wish to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Thuoc

texts.en:
Thuộc Lê T. was born in 1959. (id: 010117100016). She lives in Xom Hau, Uy No, Dong Anh with her husband and four children. Her two older daughters are married; her son is a drive; her youngest daughter is a student. 

Her husband is a carpenter, and makes chairs, beds and tables. Thuộc Lê T. sells pork in the market. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has been a member of SEDA for 3 years. This time, Thuộc Lê T. wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to support her retail business. She hopes for the opportunity to continue participating in the program for a long time.

loans.use: For retailing purposes

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
B. Edward is the leader of his group in Jinja. He is a responsible and hard -working married man with 6 children aged 16 – 4 years and all in school as he cares for 4 orphans belonging to his late brothers and sisters. His business is buying timber and transporting it from deep in the villages and this alone is a challenge that he is living with. He has had the business for 7 years and at the moment makes some good profit that enables him to pay his children’s school fees and general upkeep.

Edward’s goal is to increase his stock of timber so that he can make more profit out of it to be able to educate all his children to university level. He needs a loan to help him buy more timber for resale. Also in the photo is Richard, the Officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: Buying more timber for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de sacs de mais et d'haricots

loans.name: Sarafina

texts.en:
Sarafina is a member of the Idunda borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 25 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 9 years old. she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Sarafina has owned  a food business selling  onions, potatoes, tomatoes for 4 years, she works 12 hours  a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 95,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Sarafina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to by more commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sarafina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, onions, potatoes for sale

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. S., age 55, and is a resident at the fringe of Phnom Penh Capital, where she has owned a plot of farmland since 1979. She grows a variety of crop, which she plants twice a year. She is a good widowed mother of five children; three of whom are students and are assisting her on the farm, while the other two are garment workers. S. said that she is lacking some money to greatly grow her crop; thus, she would like to request a loan from Kiva's partner HKL. She will be used her loan to purchase fertilizer, seed, and other essential farm supply for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seed, and other essential farm supply for planting

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 49 years old and married with three children. He is a dairy farmer and has been supplying milk for about four years now. He gets a profit of approximately 20,000 Kenya Shillings per month. He wants to use the loan to buy an extra dairy cow to increase his supply. 

Antony initiated the formation of his borrower group and has never borrowed from another MFI. He supplies milk to his customers in the Rironi shopping center. He hopes to one day own more than ten dairy cows to produce enough milk to supply to the co-operative society.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow to increase milk supply

loans.name: Allakabo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Allakabo sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames traditionnels avec une moyenne d’âge de trente quatre  ans et ayant en moyenne quatre  enfants. Elles résident à Kéléya, (dans la préfecture de Bougouni) à 100  kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali).
Elles se sont connues par des liens de famille et de voisinage et font des activités de commerce d’articles divers. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 10 cartons de savon de ménage, 8 chargements de bois de chauffe, 60  kilogrammes de divers condiments alimentaires et 120  kilogrammes de divers fruits.
Elles s’approvisionnent deux fois par mois sur les marchés de Kéléya et environnants et revendent à Kéléya sur des étales ou en ambulant en détail, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle riche et variée.
Elles espèrent réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22. 000  FCFA qui servira à payer l’échéance du prêt et subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The women of the Allakabo group are married women, usually living in traditional polygamous homes. On average they are thirty four years of age and have four children. They reside in Kéléya, (in the prefecture of Bougouni) about 100 kilometers from Bamako (the capital of the Mali). They know each other by bonds of family and neighborhood and are involved in the sale of various items. They are on their fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso and all the previous loans were well reimbursed. With this loan they plan to buy 10 boxes of household soap, 8 loads of wood for heating, 60 kilograms of various food condiments and 120 kilograms of various fruit. They supply themselves two times a month in the markets of Kéléya and surrounding areas and sell to Kéléya from street locations or on foot, usually for cash and occasionally for credit to a rich and varied clientele. With this loan they hope to realize an average monthly profit of 22,000 FCFA that will serve to repay the loan and provide for the family needs.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various articles for resale such as soap, wood, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años, es casada,  tiene 02 hijos, 01 varón y 01 mujer quienes están estudiando; ella tiene estudios de primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, se dedica a  la compra y venta de thunta (Chuño blanco).

Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 con el que compró thunta, compra en Ilave y vende en Arequipa, paralelo a ello de dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores y agricultura para autoconsumo.

Ella requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1.000.00 Nuevos Soles, con ello comprará mas thunta para seguir llevando a Arequipa para su venta.

Indica que en su  Banco Comunal las socias son puntuales y eso le gusta.

Su deseo es que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen is a member of the communal bank “Jesús de Nazaret” located in the district of Ilave, in the El Collao province, Puno. She is 38 years old, married with two children (one boy and one girl) who are still in school. Señora Carmen completed elementary level studies.
She has been a member of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year. She buys and sells a potato variety called ‘thunta’ (Chuño blanco).
Her first loan was of S/. 500.00 and she used it to buy potatoes. She buys them in Ilave and sells them in Arequipa. She also raises and sells small livestock and grows agricultural products for private consumption.
She is requesting a new loan in the amount of S/. 1.000.00 Nuevos Soles, which will be used to buy more potatoes ‘thunta’ to continue to sell in Arequipa.
She likes how the members of her communal bank are very punctual with their payments.
She hopes that her children continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes (thunta).

loans.name: Aisosa

texts.en: Aisosa sells dried fish at retail prices to her customers. The demand for her dried fish is high. Dried fish is used in the preparation of local soups like 'banga', 'egusi' and okra in Nigeria. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She is 43 years old, married with 3 children. Her husband sells building materials to also support the household. She hopes for a loan amount of 120,000 NGN to purchase more dried fish to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Dorothy Wanjiru

texts.en:
For the last six years, Dorothy has run the Dot Waru Enterprise butcher shop and sells meat to residents at Mukuru Wa Njenga. She has three employees. Her business challenges are lack of water and funds to stock the business. Dorothy will be using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy an entire cow which is more economical than buying piece meat weighed in kilogrammes. In the future, she wants to runs another butchery and buy a car for the business.

Dorothy, age 49, is single and has four children ranging in age from 20 to 34 years old. She describes herself as hardworking, patient and humble.

loans.use: To buy an entire cow for slaughtering

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 56, married, and the mother of six. Two of her children are in school while the rest are working. She is very resourceful for her family in providing food and paying bills. She is a farmer and food vendor, selling kenkey with fried fish taking with pepper sauce. (Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish.)

She sells kenkey in the morning and in the afternoon. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch, and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education.

loans.use: For raw materials and firewood

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara, de 24 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora. Desde que llegó de su pueblo natal “Moho”, vive en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
Su restaurante es el más concurrido del barrio “Habitad” de la ciudad de Juliaca, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su restaurante para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo.
Llleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola y no se abastece.
Para más adelante, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante y así tener más clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo de Sara con MFP, por lo que espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas para acceder a más créditos posteriormente; en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para sus platillos, ya que la demanda por su comida ha aumentado.
texts.en:
Sara, 24, is a very down-to-earth and hard-working woman. Since she arrived from her native town, Moho, she has lived in a rented room. What she wants most of all is to succeed in life. Her restaurant is the most popular one in the Habitad neighborhood in the city of Juliaca. Everyday her customers head towards her restaurant to taste the delicious meals that she prepares. She is a very capable cook. Her love of cooking was born when she was very small, and she is now very happy to be doing this work. She has been doing this activity for two years. The most difficult thing is waiting on all of the people who come to her restaurant. Many times she has to work alone, and she cannot meet the demand. Later, she hopes to improve the infrastructure of the restaurant in order to get more customers. This is Sara’s first loan with MFP. She expects to be very punctual with her payments in order to access more loans later. She is a very participatory member of her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is asking for to buy more ingredients for her dishes because the demand for her food has increased.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem B. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field to grow rice to earn a living. In order to support the dry season farming, Mrs. Sem B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support the field crops.    
              
Mrs. Sem B. is 59 years old and lives in Chrouy village, Takeo province. She is a widow with five children. One of her children is a laborer, three others are masseurs in Phnom Penh city and the youngest one is 18 years old and a student.

loans.use: To  buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Reyna De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Reyna M., se dedica a la Ganadería en la Comunidad del Sauce, donde se dedica a la crianza de Novillos.
Solicita un Crédito para la compra de Novillos para Repasto, con el fin de obtener ingresos en un periodo corto, para continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Reyna M. works with livestock in the El Sauce community. She raises steers. She is asking for a loan to buy steers to fatten in order to get income in a short period of time. She will do this to continue bringing sustenance to her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy steers

loans.name: Jamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Jamileth de 48 años de edad es casada, tiene tres hijos, el mayor de 29, otro de 25 y el menor de 20 años de edad,  los cuales han formado su propio hogar. Jamileth  trabaja como  Enfermera de la clinica desde hace 2 años, su esposo  labora como  mecanico de motocicletas desde hace 25 años, ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar y los compromisos  adquiridos ya que son  una familia bien unida, està solicitando su 3er crèdito a la Instituciòn, para construir los servicios higienicos de su casa para tener mejores condiciones y evitar muchas enfermedades, el sueño es  tener un porvenir mejor  y ayudar a sus hijos en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Dona Jamileth, 48, is married and has three children. The oldest is 29 years old; the middle one, 25 years old; and the youngest is 20 years old. All have their own homes now. Jamileth has worked as a nurse at the medical center for 2 years. Her husband has been a motorcycle mechanic for 25 years. The couple are the center of a close family and they share household expenses. Jamileth is applying for her third loan. She wants to build a modern bathroom to improve their living conditions and to ward off many illnesses. Her dreams are for a better future and that her children have the things that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build modern bathroom.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy tiene 47 años y vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 Años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, por el cual cuenta con su propia movilidad, recorriendo así, las principales calles de la ciudad, la misma ruta ya establecida desde hace mucho. Contrato a un chofer,  por lo que se dedica ella en cobrar los pasajes, la mayoría de veces.  El servicio que brinda lo hace todos los días incluyendo los fines de semana y a pesar de haber tenido dificultades  como el alza del precio del combustible, no ha dejado de ofrecer eficientemente este servicio, con tal de salir adelante, pese a las pocas ganancias que tiene algunos días. Es por eso que desea tener otro carro más, que brinde este servicio y así poder subir sus ganancias. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y siempre ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos, por lo que reconfirma nuevamente su responsabilidad. El crédito que solicita, será invertido en la compra de algunos repuestos para su carro, así como el pago de la revisión técnica y reparación de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Susy is 47 years old and lives by herself in her own home. For the last three years, she has provided transportation services - she has her own vehicle in which she drives through the main city streets, a route she established a long time ago. Since she hired a driver, her main duty consists in handling the money. Susy works every day, including weekends, and despite having encountered problems (like the increase in fuel prices), she has not stopped offering her efficient services, which is difficult because of the low profit she makes. Susy would like to one day buy another vehicle in order to increase her profits. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she has always been responsible with her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to repair her current vehicle - buy parts and pay the mechanic.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her vehicle

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a 54-year-old father of four. He offers laundry services and has one employee. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. He was previously employed before he ventured into business.  

He is a member of a group named Miracle under Faulu Kenya, which consists of his friends who also do business. They meet frequently to catch up on their businesses and save part of their income.  Being a member of the group, he can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya since they co-guarantee each other as a group. He has therefore requested a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a washing machine.

He hopes to become financially stable in the future. Manuel is a focused man who dreams of operating a chain of laundry shops.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna P. M., tiene la edad de 42 años, está casada, y vive su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 16,12 y 8 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una máquina de coser y reparar otra que tiene en mal estado. Desea  tener máquinas en buen estado para poder aumentar su capacidad de producción de ropa y mejorar el producto. Tiene varios años de  dedicarse a la costura, y  cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad modernizar sus máquinas y así poder ofrecer calidad en sus productos, además de aportar mayores ingresos a la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como profesional.
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Mirna P. M. is 42 years old, married, and lives iwth her husband and three children ages: 16, 12, and 8. She wants a loan so she can buy a sewing machine and repair another one that is in bad shape. She wants to keep her machines in good condition so she can increase her capacity to produce clothes and also to improve her product. She has made a living sewing for seveal years and is able to count on very good customers. This is why she needs to modernize her machines so she can offer good quality products as well as providing better income for her household. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very grateful for the opportunities they have always offered her. In the future she hopes to provide her family a better quality of life and better economic stability. She would also like to continue to grow as a person and as a professional. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FU

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and to repair one that is in bad condition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita B. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Elenita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elenita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elenita has been in business for more than four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elenita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Elenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year old man from Lebanon, living with his wife and two young children who still attend school. In 2002, he opened his own clothing store to attend to the needs of the area.

He is now requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to increase the store's inventory.

loans.use: to increase the store's inventory

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa H. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old and is married. Luisa owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Luisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Luisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Zikran's Group

texts.en:
Zikran is 49 years of age but she looks ten years older than her age. Her financial problems grew her old before her time.  

She is a citizen of a city called Borewala in Pakistan, where she lives with her family. Her husband sells timbers and her two sons also help their father in his business. Zikran is a seamstress. She takes orders from her nearby customers and fulfills them to earn an income. However, her family is barely able to fulfill their basic living needs, even though everyone in the family puts forth their best effort to improve their businesses.  

Zikran has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy timbers in bulk and improves his sales.  She is hopeful that by investing this loan in her husband’s business, she will be able to make positive changes in her family’s standard of living and she will be able to marry her daughter, who is now of marriage age.

loans.use: Purchase timbers to sell

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es: Luisa Emilia tiene 42 años, su actividad es una pulpería, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Todos los días se le encuentra allá desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, por lo que siempre pasan clientes cerca de su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar huevos, leche, golosinas, granos básicos y detergentes. La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Luisa Emilia is 42 years old. Her activity is a convenience store and she has 1 child to support. Every day she can be found at the store from 6 in the morning to 7 at night and customers always stop by. She is requesting a loan to buy eggs, milk, candy, basic grains and detergents. She appreciates and is extremely grateful for this loan, which will allow her to grow her business and improve her standard of living. She is also committed to meeting her repayment schedule on time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Judith Sandra

texts.es: La Señora Sandra se dedica a trabajar como costurera, desde hace cinco años, principalmente costura mandiles y delantales, ella únicamente se encarga de la costura la compra de tela , hilos y otros esta a cargo de la señora que vende dichos mandiles, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo, su hijo Denis quien es independiente y su hija de 18 años quien estudia en la universidad. El monto que solicitan es para comprar otra puerta para su vehículo, el cual lo maneja su esposo, la movilidad  sufrió un accidente al salir un pasajero, una moto choco contra esta y lo doblo por completo, quedando inservible la puerta, y esta con esta necesidad por que su esposo trabaja con este vehículo y necesita para su reparación, ya que este también lo utiliza para llevar su mercadería a la venta.
texts.en:
Sandra has worked as a seamstress for 5 years, and primarily sews aprons. She is only in charge of the sewing. Another woman who sells the aprons purchases the fabric, thread, and other supplies. Sandra's family is made up of her husband, her son Denis who lives independently, and her 18-year old daughter who is in college. The amount she is requesting is for the purchase of a new door for her vehicle, which her husband drives. The door was bent in half when a passenger got out of the car and a motorcycle hit the door. The door can no longer be used, and Sandra needs it to be fixed because her husband uses the vehicle for work, and it is also used to take her merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new door for her car

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en: Suraiya lives in a big city called Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is 35 years old and lives with her family in a one-room brick house. She belongs to a poor family. She got married to M. J., who has a business making shoes to earn money for the family. He has been engaged in this business for the past 16 years. He works for some big factories that give him orders to fulfill. Suraiya supports her family financially as a midwife. She is the mother of four sons, all of whom are very young and getting their education. Suraiya’s husband wants to expand his shoe-making business by introducing his work to more factories. To do this, he needs raw materials. Suraiya has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, her husband will buy leather, nails, and shoe polish in larger quantities. She is hopeful that, with the help of a loan, her husband will be able to improve his business, and that will help her family to enjoy a better quality of life. Suraiya is in her second loan cycle. In previous loan years she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed meetings.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for shoe-making business

loans.name: Selma

texts.en: Selma B. is from the village of Larion Bajo, Tuguegarao City. She is 51 years old. Selma is married and has an adult child. To make a living, Selma makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Selma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Selma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Selma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Selma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Insculas del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza y comercialización de animales. El adquiere los animales a los vecinos del lugar, los engorda y luego los vende a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Usualmente comercializa ovejas. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y sacar adelante a su familia.
Fidel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para así poder ampliar sus ventas y pedir más ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales espera seguir adquiriendo ovejas para lograr su objetivo.
Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.En la imagen aparace junto a sus hijos
texts.en:
Fidel is a 24 year old family man.  He lives with his wife and their children in the Insculas sector of the Olmos district.  It is an agricultural zone located in the Lambayeque province, which is over an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been raising and selling animals for four years.  He gets the animals from neighbors in the area.  He fattens them and then sells them to merchants who always visit the area where he lives.  He usually sells sheep.  The business helps him pay for personal expenses, and it helps get the family ahead.

Fidel wishes to expand his business by purchasing more animals.  That way he would be able to increase sales and solicit more income.  

That is why he believed it was advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 2,000 soles.  He plans use the loan to continue getting sheep in order to obtain his objective. 

His greatest desire is to continue growing as a businessman in order to improve his family’s quality of life.  People who know him hold him in high esteem and trust him.

He appears in the photo with his children.

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan N. is from the village of Santa Rosa. She is 30 years old. Joan is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Joan is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 41 años, es una mujer responsable, junto a su esposo, Gregorio, de 62 años, trabajan con perseverancia, para sacar adelante a sus 3 pequeños hijos, a los que cuidan y educan con mucho amor, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas del día, Gregorio, realiza trasporte público, en la ruta Tarma – Huaricolca; mientras que Lida atiende a su clientes, que constantemente visitan su tienda de comestibles, donde no solo vende productos de primera necesidad; sino también “leña” (que utilizan, para cocinar los alimentos), producto que tienen buena demanda en la zona. Como  hace 10 años, ambos se dedican todo el día al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembran papa y avena; los que después de cosecharlos los comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad. En adelante tienen planeado comprar una casa en el centro de la ciudad, ahí desean expandir su negocio de comestibles, así como también abrir su granja de cuyes. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde sus integrantes son personas muy responsables. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, para las 4 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, donde sembrarán papa, en estos días.
texts.en: Lida is 41 years old and a responsible woman.  She and her husband, 62 year-old Gregorio, work with perseverance to get their 3 small children ahead in life.  They care for and educate their children with a lot of love, in their own home in the rural region of Huaricolca.  Every morning from very early, Gregorio works as a public transport driver on the Tarma-Huaricola route while Lida serves the customers who constantly visit her grocery store where she sells not only basic groceries but also firewood (which they use to cook their food).  This is a product which is in great demand in the area.  For the past 10 years, Lida and Gregorio have also spent every day tending their plots of land where they grow potato and oats.  After harvesting their crops they sell them in the central market in the town.  In the future they plan to buy a house in the town center where they can expand their grocery business as well as opening a guinea pig farm.  This is Lida's second loan from MFP and she is very happy to belong to her community bank as the other members are very responsible people.  With this loan she will buy sacks of organic fertilizer for her 4 hectares of land where she will shortly sow her potatos.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy S., 46, is married and resides with her husband and children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

S. and her husband sell watermelons and corn, earning an income of about USD 8 per day. S. has to spend USD 100 on food, USD 7 on electricity and water supplies and USD 76 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more watermelons to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more watermelons to sell

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Susana is one of the members of the Group Dios es mi pastor 1, 2 & 3 (God is My Shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. This city, like many others in the Dominican Republic, has a shortage of drinking water and electricity and is populated by Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. Susana sells miscellaneous products in her business, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, accessories, etc. With this new loan, she is planning to invest in more of these products since there is a lot of demand for her items at this time of the year.

Susana is very excited to receive her sixth loan from Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loans, having thus taken a step towards expanding her business. She tells us that her challenge is to work hard in order to turn her business into a successful store. She enjoys being at home with her long-term partner and 5 children. She is planning to reinvest her profits in the business, since there will be a lot of demand for her products. Her dream is to see all her children become professionals and good people.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, accessories, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul   solicito 400 $us; trabaja  en una fábrica de ladrillos como empleado. Vive en la zona Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto. Es soltero.

El crédito que solicita lo destinara en la compra de computadora para la continuación de sus estudios. Es el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Raul is requesting a loan for $400 USD.  He works as an employee in a brick-making factory and lives in Mercurio neighborhood of the city of El Alto.  He is single.

Raul will use his loan to buy a computer so that he can continue his studies.  This is his first loan with Impro and his first Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy a computer to continue with his studies

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es:
Don José, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, tiene 41 años vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y una bebe de 6 mese de nacida, se dedica a la vena de electrodomésticos, negocio que inicio con uno de sus hermanos, pero que luego instalo un negocio propio y que su suegro le ayuda a vender, su horario es de 6:00am a 7:00pm, por el momento don José necesita un préstamo para la compra de artículos y abastecer el negocio.
Con este préstamo estará fortaleciendo su puesto de venta y contara con artículos que en ocasiones le son buscados por los clientes. Don José busca el crecimiento en el comercio y ser competente ante los demás negocios, además de generar para su familia los ingresos que son tan necesarios para saldar necesidades.
texts.en:
José lives in San Miguel, in San Miguel department.  He is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 6 month-old baby girl.  José's business is selling electrical appliances.  He started his business together with one of his brothers but then he set up on his own.  His father-in-law helps him in his business.  José works from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Right now he needs a loan to buy goods and stock his business.

José will use this loan to strengthen his sales location and have in stock goods that his customers are sometimes looking for.  José is looking to grow his business and be competitive as regards other businesses.  He would also like to make enough income to cover his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy goods to stock his business

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
Juana Evangelista H. es comerciante activa del Mercado Oriental de Managua desde hace quince años, ella trabaja de lunes a sábados de 6 de la mañana hasta las cinco  de la tarde, es madre de cuatro hijos dos menores de edad y uno se encuentra en edad escolar los otros mayores ya no dependen de ella.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, clavos, pintura y mano de obra para su casa. Ha trabajado tres prestamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para su negocio el cual ha venido incrementando gracias a los financiamientos que ceprodel le ha brindado y este ultimo lo quiere para hacerle algunas mejoras a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Juana Evangelista H. has been an active merchant at the Mercado Oriental in Managua for 15 years.  She works Mondays through Saturdays from six in the morning until five in the afternoon.  She has four children.  Two of them are minors, and one is school age.  The others are grown and are no longer dependent upon her.  

The requested loan is to buy construction materials like zinc, purlins, nails, paint, and to pay for the labor for her house.  She has had three loans with Ceprodel.  These have been for her business, which has been growing thanks to the loans that Ceprodel provided for her.  She wants to use this loan to pay for some improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials like zinc, purlins, nails, paint, and to pay for the labor for her house

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
Yoni nació en la ciudad de Marcapata provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Yoni vive en la ciudad Ocongate junto con su esposo y su hija de un año. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Yoni es una mujer joven y humilde que tiene 24 años, ella abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y está ubicado en la calle Libertad de la ciudad de Ocongate. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10  de la noche en su tienda. 
 
Yoni requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos  y muchas cosas más que falta en la tienda. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Yoni was born in the city of Marcapata in the Quispicanchis providence and Cusco department. She currently lives in the city of Ocongate with her husband and one year old daughter. (The city of Ocongate is located two hours from the city of Cusco). Yoni is a humble young woman who is 24 years old. She opened a small grocery store that is located on Liberty street ("Libertad") in the city of Ocongate. You can find her working in her store 7 days a week from 8:00 a.m. until 10 p.m. Yoni needs a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles, and much more that is missing from the store. She is grateful for the opportunity afforded and agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use:
para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más que falta en la tienda. 

To buy goods such as rice, sugar, noodles and much more that is missing from the store.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, es comerciante de libros, el crédito que solicita  será utilizado en compra de más libros para su puesto de venta en la ciudad de La Paz;  está divorciada y tiene dos hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus padres,  en zona Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de El Alto. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva.
texts.en: Lucy is a bookseller.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more books for her sales stall in the city of La Paz.  Lucy is divorced and has two children aged 13 and 9.  She lives in her parents' home, in Mariscal Sucre district, in the city of El Alto.  This is her second loan from IMPRO and her second through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more books for her stall

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business buying and selling firewood/charcoal. Her husband Paulino, who is 58 years old, works as a construction worker to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 18 and 36 years old. Three of their children have their own families and one has her own job and helps her parents run the business. Lydia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lydia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, to buy firewood and charcoal for resale so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Lydia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

In the accompanying photo, Lydia poses with the stacks of firewood that she sells.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and charcoal to resell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa D. is from the town of District 1, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 55 years old. Elsa is married and has nine adult children. 

To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as soft drinks, sugar and coffee. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elsa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as soft drinks, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.en:
Jorge is 28 years old, married and has two children. He lives in his own house in the urban part of the José Leonardo Ortiz district of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. His community is small yet shows many signs of development.

For more than five years, Jorge has earned a living by providing passenger transportation services in a taxicab and a "mototaxi", a unit that consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for carrying people. Currently, he rents both of these vehicles. Jorge has requested a loan so that he can make urgent repairs to the air-conditioning and the muffler in his taxicab. With these repairs, he will be able to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he can provide excellent service to his customers and continue generating income. For this reason, Jorge has requested a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. 

Jorge’s taxi service has been quite profitable and he plans in the near future to purchase his own taxicab, which will be the start of a small fleet of cabs he hopes to own and manage. Jorge is very hard-working and responsible. He has had loans from Edpyme Alternativa in the past and repaid his debt on time. Thanks to his past loans and the income from his business, Jorge was able to purchase a small plot of land where he constructed his house. His greatest wish is to continue growing his business so that he can continue improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to repair the muffler and air conditioning in his taxicab.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents and two siblings. He has been working in his own vegetable shop for the past four years. He sells all types of vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, and lettuce, etc. 

This young man knows how to benefit from life opportunities since at the same time, he has been working as a pet dealer for two years in order to make extra money for the family. We note that he is a hard worker running double jobs and pursuing his education at the same time.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase supplementary goods to increase his sales and thus his income. In the future, he is planning to make his shop bigger by adding more merchandise to it such as fruits, daily necessities, and dairy products .

loans.use: to purchase supplementary products.

loans.name: Deolinda Almeida

texts.pt:
Deolinda Almeida M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 1 filho de idade escolar. Fez 12ª classe não continuou porque teve que começar a trabalhar para aliviar algumas despesas familiares. Vive na casa cedida pelos tios com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu de Boane sua terra natal, é funcionaria do Ministerio de Educação trabalha como docente ha mais de 8 anos. Tem um salario mensal de 7.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua amiga que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt e 12.000.00mt aplicados na habitação.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. O seu Sonho é de solicitar novos empréstimos para concluir a casa e continuar com os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Deolinda Almeida M. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of one school-age child. She completed 12th grade and didn't continue with her schooling because she needed to start working to contribute to family expenses. She lives with her family in a house given to her by her uncles and doesn't support anyone additional.

She has never left Boane, her native region, and is an employee of the Ministry of Education. She has worked as a teacher for over eight years. Her monthly salary is 7000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses and is able to save a portion of in her bank account.

She has had loans at other banks, and learned of Hluvuku through her friend who is a client there. This is her third loan at Hluvuku. The loan is for 15,500 meticais, with which she plans to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, and other items) to continue building her house. The previous loans were for 5,000 and 12,000 meticais, both for the house. 

She is committed to paying on schedule to be able to obtain future loans. Her dream is to request loans to complete the house and continue with her studies.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, and other items).

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora, tiene la edad de 32 años , habitan en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para compartir los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen tres hijos los cuales estudian su primaria , los planes hacia un futuro es poder terminar de construir la vivienda  , ya que con los dos créditos anterior logro  repellar la parte delantera de la casa y embaldosar , ahora quiere que se le apoye para poder cerrar un cuarto ya que ella es comerciante de frutas y verduras y no cuenta con grandes ganancias para  comprar de una sola solo vez materiales de construcción como bloques, arena , cemento , zinc , etc. .Agradece la confianza brindada por Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que apoyan a los pobres para que sus condiciones de vida cambien y sea para desarrollo del mismo país.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora, age 32, lives in the town of Ticuantepe, with her husband who shares the household expenses.  They have three children in primary school.  Their plans for the future are to finish building their house, since the first two loans they received were used to add siding and tile to the front of the house.  Now they are requesting support to finish a room.

She is a fruit and vegetable vendor and does not have enough income to buy all the construction materials, such as blocks, sand, cement, zinc, etc., at one time.  She is grateful for the confidence shown in her by Afodenic through the Kiva fund which helps people in poverty change their conditions, thus leading to development in the same country.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 32 years of age and married with two school-aged children. She is engaged in farming activities where she plants and harvests rice to sell.

Maritess is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Maritess has operated this business for almost four years. With her income, she is able to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

location.town: Brgy. San Fabian, Kayapa, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jesús Francisco

texts.en:
Jesús Francisco is 29 years old and lives in San Gabriel, located in the northern region of Ecuador. He is single and has two children, aged 8 and 3. 

Jesús Francisco is a responsible and hard-working person. He is dedicated to raising and selling pigs from his home. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more pigs to expand his business. He also wants to improve the space where his pigs live. He began raising pigs with little working capital and began seeking loans through FODEMI two years ago. 

He is happy to have his own business and his own source of income. In the future he would like to own more pigs and be able to provide job opportunities to his family and others looking for work.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and improve the space where his pigs live.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 30 años, es natural de la ciudad de San Francisco,  vive en su propia morada al lado de su pareja Efraín de 33 años y sus 02 queridos hijos José de 05 años y Roció de de 02 años de edad a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación para que en un futuro próximo sean hombres de gran provecho. Ruth es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor de si misma a los miembros de su casta familiar. Ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde siembra sobre sus tierras, achiote, palillo, café y cacao. Ha realizado esta actividad durante 18 años con mucho cuidado y laboriosidad,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas, ella compró media hectárea de terreno para seguir cultivando. Por otro lado compró maquinas fumigadoras para el control de la  plaga de insectos. Considera que este trabajo demanda mucho esfuerzo, por ello cuando se trata de limpiar y cosechar tiene que contratar peones para que le ayuden con este trabajo  ya que debe seleccionarlos y prepararlos para ser llevados hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad e San Francisco y Quimbiri donde recibe buena paga por los granos que produce. Ella cuenta con espacios de tierra sin cultivar, lo cual inevitablemente necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar consigo su trabajo. Tiene planeado sembrar sus fincas con más plantas de café es por ello que acude a los prestamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante   a sus adorados hijos. Este será el crédito número 06 con MFP, es por ello espera del apoyo de los financistas para poder concretar sus planes y por ende se compromete a devolver  puntualmente los pagos. En su banco comunal ocupa el cargo de presidente quien vela por el progreso de los socios. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más semillas de café.
texts.en:
Ruth, age 30, is from the city of San Francisco.  She lives in her own home with her life partner, 33 year old Efraín, and their two beloved children.  José is 5, and Roció is 2.  She wishes to provide them with a good education so that in the near future they will become useful people.

Ruth is a woman who works arduously.  Every day she strives to give the best of herself to her household.  She works in agriculture.  She plants annatto, palillo (a condiment), coffee, and cacao on her land.  She has been doing this very carefully and laboriously for 18 years.   Thanks to the profits from her plants, she bought a half of a hectare of land in order to continue growing her crops.  

In addition to this, she bought fumigation machines to control pest infestations.  She feels that this work demands a lot of effort.  Therefore, when it is time to clear the fields and harvest she hires workers to help her with the work.  They need to pick the crops and prepare them to be taken to the collection centers.  The centers are in the cities of San Franscisco and Quimbirii, where she gets good payment for the grains she produces.  

She has some land that she does not cultivate.  It inevitably needs the support of the financial institution in order to carry on with her work.  She plans to plant her farmland with more coffee plants.  That is why she goes for the loans that the MFP institution facilitates for people with little resources who are looking to progress.

She hopes to have her characteristic strength and impetus in order to do good work to get her adorable children ahead.  This will be her sixth loan with MFP.  She hopes to have the support of the lenders in order to be able to make her plans a reality.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She is the president of her communal bank, and she watches over the members’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy more coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr:
Cliente de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 13 ans.Ayant deja bénéficiee deja de deux prêts de Hope, elle a rembourse sans difficulte et a fait des épargnes considérables.

Avec le troisième prêt elle va élargir son activité en achetant des produits de beauté, des produits cosmétiques, un appareil a manucure et pédicure, des tissages et mèches.Elle a l'intention d'élargir son activité en améliorant aussi son salon de coiffure et ajouter un autre casque.
Elle a des stratégies très viable, baisser les prix pour attirer la clientèle pour faire plus de benefices.  

Pour l'avenir, elle veut agrandir son salon et faire beaucoup de benefices pour soutenir les etudes de ses enfants .
texts.en:
This client is 37 years old, married, and has three children who are between 3 and 13 years old. Having already benefited from two loans through Hope, she has made her repayments without difficulty and built up considerable savings.

With this third loan, she is going to expand her business by buying beauty and cosmetic products, a manicure and pedicure set, weaves, and hair extensions. She intends to expand her business also by improving her hair salon and adding another hair dryer.

She has very viable strategies, namely to lower prices to attract more customers and make a larger profit.

In the future, she wants to extend her salon and make large profits in order to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, hair straighteners, manicure and pedicure items, and hair extensions.

loans.name: María Ciria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ciria, tiene 72 años de edad, hace varios años el compañero de toda su vida falleció pero de esa relación tuvo 12 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, una de sus hijos aun vive con ella.
 
Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy trabajadora y que para lograr tener para sus gastos hace varios años se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales, productos tanto personales como para el hogar (planchas, zapatos, licuadoras, entre otras cosas), estos los vende a través del sistema de cartillas, su forma de venta es puerta. Lleva más de 15 años dedicada al comercio y le ha ido muy bien. Ella también utiliza parte del crédito para darle a su hijo para su negocio pues vende queso en el mercado local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos naturales, productos para el hogar y queso para el negocio del hijo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 11 años y le gusta porque le han ayudado mucho con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local en su casa.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "Mujeres con Esperanza" community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds owing to the large quantity of tamarind trees that used to exist there years ago.

Here we meet 72 year-old Ciria.  Several years ago Ciria's life partner died but she had 12 children from that relationship who are all now grown up and living independently.  One of her children still lives with her.

Our friend is a very hard-working woman and, in order to cover her expenses, years ago she started working in commerce, selling natural products, and both personal products and products for the home (irons, shoes, blenders, etc.).  She sells these through a credit system.  She makes her sales door to door.  She has been in business for 15 years and has done very well.
