HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Bismark M. se dedica a la venta de pollo en su propio establecimiento donde a diario ofrece el producto a todos los visitantes del mercado.

El motive por el que ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel es porque requiere de la compra del pollo para su venta en su localidad y es por este motivo que no duda en solicitarlo en Ceprodel para continuar con su negocio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua, Mr. Bismark M. sells chickens in his own store, where daily he offers chickens to all of the market’s visitors. He is seeking a loan from Ceprodel because he needs to buy chickens to sell in his store. Because of this reason, he is requesting the loan from Ceprodel to continue with his business so that he can bring sustenance to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa Mendoza está muy agradecida por su ayuda en el anterior crédito que le servio para mejora su negocio de venta de tamales.
Nueva vente está solicitando su cooperación para un préstamo el cual tiene el proyecto de comprar mas vehículos para vender en diferentes partes de la ciudad y así su negocio tendrá más ingresos ya generara empleo para tres personas más.
Doña Elsa es soltera, vive de las ventas que tiene su negocio con el cual quiere superarse y ayudar a otras personas.
texts.en:
Elsa Mendoza is very grateful for the help from the previous loan to improve her tamale selling business. She is asking for your cooperation again for a loan. She will buy more vehicles in order to sell in different parts of the city. That way her business will have more income, and it will generate employment for three more people. Else is single. She lives from the sales from her business. She wants to succeed and help other people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Peles

texts.en:
Peles is a member of the Mtwivila borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 30  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 11, 7, and 1 years old.

Peles has owned a clothing business selling Vitenge for 1 year, she works 9 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 160,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Peles`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitenge(fabric) for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Peles hopes to save money, pay school fess and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge

loans.name: Khak

texts.en: Mrs. Khak K. is a farmer in Phnom Lon Tas village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice and her husband, Mr. Siv Yong, is a cow breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it through a loan to buy more cows for breeding and selling. Mrs. Khak K. is 41 years-old and the mother of three children.  Two of the children are employed in Casino club and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more cows.

loans.name: Josee

texts.en:
Josee M. is 39 years old and married with two children aged 12 and 18. She and her family live in Nyamata district, Eastern Province, Rwanda, where her business is located.

Josee has been a successful entrepreneur since 1999 – 10 years! She works by herself in this business with no employees or helpers.

Josee is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business of making soft drinks from sorghum, by purchasing needed materials as well as providing necessary working capital. All of this, she projects, will help her to earn more profit.

With this profit, she will be able to obtain more food for her family and save money for buying her own house some day, as well as to continue to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making sorghum soft drinks

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo, tiene un taller donde elabora cotillones y los vende en la calle Illampu, un lugar de la ciudad de La Paz donde se comercializa productos para fiestas y eventos de todo tipo.
Vive en la zona de san pedro  de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo ( compra de cartulina, papel, cola, y otros). 
Es la Décima quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Arturo has a shop where he makes party favors. He sells them on Illampu Street, a place in the city of La Paz where products for parties and all types of events are sold. He lives in his own house in the San Pedro region of the city of La Paz The loan is to buy cardboard, paper, glue, and other things. This is the fifteenth time he has asked Impro for a loan. His history qualifies him as client 1, which means good completion of paying his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cardboard, paper, glue, and other supplies to make party favors and piñatas.

loans.name: Los Picaflores Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los picaF.” esta conformado por 14 personas alegres y trabajadoras, tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo y sus edades varían desD. 19 hasta 63 años. La presidenta Cristina tiene 2 hijos pequeños los mismos van a la escuela primaria, ella al igual que sus compañeras se dedica a la venta D. productos venta D. carteras, el resto D. los miembros del grupo se dedica a la venta D. verduras, venta D. ropa interior, venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, comida y al servicio D. limpieza domestica; algunos D. sus puestos D. venta son fijos y otras son ambulantes. Sus competidores D. negocios están presentes, pero las señoras tienen clientes fieles que adquieren productos constantemente, en caso D. dificultades en sus negocios, diversifican su actividad comercial para obtener ingresos, algunas D. ellas empiezan a trabajar medio tiempo con un sueldo fijo en actividades D. limpieza D. viviendas y el otro medio tiempo atienden su negocio. Las socias quieren aprovechar las ofertas D. cosméticos por catálogos adquiriendo más mercadería e insumos para generar un mayor ingreso para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Las socias esta emprendiendo su tercer ciclo demostrando ganas D. salir adelante, responsabilidad, honradez y sobre todo unión que es lo esencial en un grupo solidario. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su primer ciclo pero en la reuniones han demostrando ganas D. salir adelante, responsabilidad, honradez y sobre todo unión que es lo esencial en un grupo solidario
texts.en:
The group "Los picaF." consists of 14 happy and hard-working people. They have been friends for a long time, and their ages vary from 19 to 63 years old. The president, Cristina, has 2 small children who are in elementary school. Along with her partners, she makes a living selling products, specifically wallets. The rest of the members of the group make a living selling vegetables, underwear, groceries in local stores, and other food, as well as providing a domestic cleaning service. Some have stands for selling their products, while others are mobile. They do have competitors, but these women have faithful clients who consistently acquire products from them. In case of difficulties in their businesses, they diversify their commercial activity to obtain better incomes. Some of them begin to work part time with a fixed salary from cleaning homes, and part time attending to their business. Our partners would like to take advantage of selling cosmetics by catalogue, acquiring more merchandise and materials to generate a better income, in order to proviD. their families with a better quality of life. They are undertaking their third cycle of loans, demonstrating a desire to get ahead in life, responsibility, integrity, and above all unity, which is essential in a solidarity group.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital for their businesses

loans.name: Sofi

texts.en:
Sofi R. currently sells food in a hotel and is requesting a loan to purchase beer and soft drinks such as sodas, water, packed juice, etc to sell.  Sofi is 42 years old and is married to a peasant. She has eight children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children up to the university.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beer and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Assana

texts.en: Madame A. lives in the Agoé region with her husband and her 2 children. In 2001, she began selling charcoal. To maximize the profit from her sales, she purchases her supply from the city of Paguala in the center of Togo. This strategy gives her a competitive edge in her market. Currently facing a lack of stock, she has applied for a loan with WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase 30 large bags and 20 medium-sized bags of charcoal and will cover the cost of her travels.

loans.use: buying charcoal and paying for transport

loans.name: Argelis Rolando

texts.es:
Argelis N. de 27 años, su casa es de cemento y esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa trabaja como profesora parvularia en el Instituto Simon Bolívar  en Guayaquil tiene 2 hijos uno de 1 año y otro de 5 meses.

Argelis comenzó trabajando en la farmacia de su mama poco a poco pudo reunir dinero y comprarle la farmacia, después de unos años para tener otro ingreso adicional puso a lado de la farmacia la tienda con unas pocas cosas, ahora Arcelis trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 00h30 de lunes a domingo en la farmacia y la tienda, una de las mayores complicaciones son los racionamientos de electricidad del gobierno. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar dulces, víveres, arroz, para la tienda. En el futuro quiere expandir su negocio con una sucursal e incrementar los productos que vende.
texts.en:
Argelia N. is 27 years old. His house is made of cement, and it is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. His wife works as a nursery school teacher in the Simon Bolívar Institue in Guayaquil. He has two children; one is one year old and the other is five months. Argelis started working in his mother’s pharmacy. Little by little he was able to get together money to buy the pharmacy. In order to have additional income, a few years later he put a store with a few things next to the pharmacy. Arcelis now works from six until three from Monday to Sunday in the pharmacy and the store. One of the biggest problems is the rationing of electricity by the government. With the loan he wants to buy sweets, supplies, and rice for the store. In the future he wants to expand his business with a branch and increase the products that he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sweets, supplies, and rice

loans.name: Claire's Group

texts.en:
Claire R. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 18 years old, single, and the leader of a six-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
To make a living, Claire owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Claire has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Claire joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Claire is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dor

texts.en:
Mrs. Dor Y., 49, lives in a rural territory of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She owns a plot of farmland in the village where she plants different kinds of crops to earn a living. She has a partner in her husband, who climbs palm trees to tap juice which he boils into sugar to sell for a profit. 

The couple is responsible for four children, including school fees, clothing, and medicine. Another three of their children are married and have established new families. 

Dor Y. is taking out her loan to buy three cows which will alleviate her physical labor in plowing the farmland. In the future, she proposes to raise a cow to produce calves to sell.

loans.use: To buy three cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Q.  vive en casa propia tiene 1  hija. La misma se dedica a la costura y venta de ropas, posee maquinas de cocer en su domicilio en la cuidad de Luque y un local de venta de ropas en la ciudad de Fernando de la Mora.
 A la fecha la titular ha retirado un préstamo para la compra de telas para realizar trabajos ya que posee varios pedidos que le estaría dejando buenos ingresos para la unidad familiar.
La  titular opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año  2003  abonando en fecha todos sus  prestamos, y a la ves  le han ayudado para su inversión y mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia Q. lives in her own home and has a daughter. She makes her living sewing and selling clothing; she has sewing machines in her home. She lives in the city of Luque and has a shop where she sells clothing in the city of Fernando de la Mora. As of today, Mrs. Q. has taken out a loan to buy fabric so she can finish some work she has pending, work that is earning her a good income for her family. She has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2003 and has paid all of her loans on time. The loans have helped her invest and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Gladys Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 23  años. Ya son tres ciclos que participa en el banco comunal. Su principal actividad económica es atender el restaurante “Antojitos” que está ubicado cerca a la plaza de armas de la ciudad Cusco. Ella trabaja como moza desde 9 mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. 

Ella por las tardes estudia la carrera profesional de turismo en el instituto superior “Khipu” y está cursando el cuarto semestre, ella nos cuenta que con su trabajo paga sus mensualidades.

Zoraida es una joven responsable que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregarse un mejor futuro. Ella requiere el crédito para pagar sus mensualidades del instituto. El anhelo de la socia es abrir su propio restaurante  turístico  en la plaza de armas.   

Zoraida se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Zoraida belongs to the loan group "Mi Peru" of the Arariwa Association. She is 23 years old. She has been a part of this loan group for three cycles. Her main economic activity is serving in the restaurant Antojitos, which is located close to the Plaza de Armas in Cusco. She works as a waitress from 9 in the morning to 3 in the afternoon.

In the afternoons, she takes a course in tourism in the Instituto Superior Khipu. She is in her fourth semester. She tells us that she pays her monthly school fees by working.

Zoraida is a responsible young woman who is always looking for the opportunity to progress and secure a better future with her daily efforts. She needs a loan to pay for her monthly school fees at the Instituto. Her dream is to open her own restaurant for tourists in the Plaza de Armas.

Zoraida is thankful for the opportunity provided by Kiva and promises to make her repayments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying school fees

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 33-year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He has been the owner of a car painting garage for more than 15 years. His customers include friends, neighbors and other community members who have come to know him through his work. Mhamad is extremely proud of his work and believes that it is his experience that has helped him succeed.

Mhamad is requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to invest in paint equipment and supplies, as well as save for his future home. In the future, Mhamad hopes to further expand his business and provide greater support to his family.

loans.use: To buy paint equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita N. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de oro City. She is 44 years old. Rosita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 22000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kick Poor United Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Kick Poor United” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek for a loan of SLL 2,700,000 for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Issa L., pictured in the middle. Issa was born in Magburaka town about 38 years ago. He is married and has five children. His wife is a businesswoman and three of his children attend school – one in primary school and two in secondary school. For nine years now, Issa has been selling used items like bags, belts, shoes, caps, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy more bags, belts and caps to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy more bags, belts and caps to add to his current stock

loans.name: Orolmaa

texts.en:
Orolmaa D. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and one son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband currently works as a driver in a private company in Ulaanbaatar. Her son attends a district middle school. 

Orolmaa lives in a 'ger', which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent  with her family. She operates a meat sales business in Bayanzurh, one of the biggest and most crowded markets located in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, and provides a variety of meats for her customers. She started her meat sales business in 2000 and has gained much business experience over the years. 

Today she has a very loyal customer base, and her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT with the daily revenues of 150,000 to 300,000 MNT. For the future, Orolmaa is planning to expand her business, and hopes to one day own her own workspace. She is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital so as to purchase more meat.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Horm

texts.en:
Mr. Horm O., 33 years old (in the picture), and his wife, Mrs. Sarorn Meas, 31 years old, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2005 and have two daughters. Both of them are still young.      
 
Horm has been a construction worker for seven years. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Nghiêm's Group

texts.en:
H.  Nghiêm Thị is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  H.  is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm Xá nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09).

H.  is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To making a living, H.  works in the services sector operating a tailoring business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,800,000 VND a month.

In 2007, H.  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,600,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to invest in renovating the business.  This will be H.’s 4th loan from SEDA.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Mẫn Thị D. is a 24 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nghiêm Thị Lượng is a 29 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in a historic city of Pakistan called Lahore.  She is 36 years old and has given birth to three sons and two daughters. All of them are getting their education. Her husband has a business selling ready-made garments. He takes orders from different ready-made garment shops and supplies the order by purchasing the clothing from factories. 

Nasreen herself is a seamstress, and she works full time. She gets orders from her neighborhood customers and sews beautifully designed clothes to earn a supplementary income for the family. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan for her husband who wants to buy a large quantity of ready-made garments to fill larger orders on time. Her husband is of the view that by taking larger orders he can earn more profits because there are better profit margins when dealing with big parties. Nasreen is hopeful that her husband will be able to earn big profits by investing money in his business.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah. She has maintained a good credit record in her previous two years of borrowing. Now she is on her third loan.

loans.use: Purchase ready-made garments for resale

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia C. is from the village of Pta. Miray, Baliangao. She is 61 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia runs a grocery store. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2004, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 54,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the existing business

loans.name: David Mwangi

texts.en:
David Mwangi is 53 years old and married to Fraciah K.. They have three children. He keeps dairy cows and he gets a profit of about 5,500 KES a month. He has been in the business for a period of about five years.

David intends to use his loan to buy feed for the dairy cows and buy an extra calf. He was introduced to KADET by a staff member and is hoping to buy a piece of land to develop. His dream is to be a leading milk supplier in his area and to give his children a quality education.

loans.use: Buy feed for the dairy cow

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en:
Amarzaya G., age 29, lives with her husband and six-year-old daughter in Tuv, the central province of Mongolia. They live together in a ger (traditional Mongolian tent home) on a small plot of land. Her daughter attends a local primary school. Her husband is a builder, but currently helps out Amarzaya's business by transporting meats from the countryside using his truck. 

Amarzaya operates a meat trading business in a rented stall at Bayanhaan market, the one of local markets in the city. She has been operating this business for the last six years and has become quite a successful businesswoman. She purchases meat at wholesale prices from the countryside. Over the years, she has gained not only much experience but also a wide customer base. 

Amarzaya is a modest, generous and hardworking woman. She hopes to expand her business and improve her living conditions by building a new winter house for her family in the future. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of meat at wholesale prices for her business.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve a large amount of meat

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk R., 46, is married and lives with her four children in the Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband, pictured here, sells traditional medicines making US$4 each day.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have resulted in a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Ouk R. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to expand her farmland. In order to increase her profits and possibly raise her standard of living, she would like to purchase more land to produce rice with the loan given to her through CREDIT.

loans.use: To purchase farmland.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita Q. is from the village of Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Lolita is widowed and has 8 grown children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, candies, biscuits, toothpaste and others in the local community. Lolita is just starting this business.

In 2010, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
A very hardworking mother is Nerissa O. one of the active members of ASHI Antique North Branch. She is already 60 years old and a resident of Bitadton, Culasi, Philippines. She is married to a very supportive husband Gilberto O.. Through their courage and industry, one of their children finished  college and got a degree.

They earn income through her variety store and the income that they earn from this business has been a great help to cover their basic needs. Though the income from this business is unstable, she is really wise in using the capital entrusted to her by the Institution. 

At the age of 60, she is still strong and always inspired in doing her business. On the other hand; her business gives her an income and the same time pleasure.

She is dreaming that someday her youngest child Gilner will also finish her studies through college and in that way, she will find a decent job someday because she doesn't want their children and their grandchildren to experience the hardships brought on by poverty.

Presently she is applying for a loan amounting to Php.8,000 which will be used as additional capital for her variety store business.

loans.use: Variety Store

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos José tiene 26 años, su actividad es la venta de tortillas, pinol, carnes entre otros. Cuando inicio fue por la falta de empleo ya que no tenía un trabajo estable que le proporcionara ingresos necesarios para su esposa y su hijo que están a su cargo. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable y trabajador. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de tortillas, tamales y pinolillo. Su negocio le exige salir todos los días para ofrecer los diferentes productos.
texts.en: Carlos José is a 26-year-old who sells tortillas, pinol (flour made from toasted maiz), meats, and other goods. He started his business because he did not have a stable job that would provide him with the income necessary to support his wife and son. He has always been known for being a very responsible and hard-working person. This loan will be used to purchase tortillas, tamales, and pinolillo (cornstarch). His business requires him to go out and sell his different products every day.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose Nehemias

texts.es:
José Nehemías, reside en El Divisadero departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, posee un taller de estructuras metálicas y construcción, este trabajo lo realiza en ocasiones en su casa y en otras sale a domicilio, sus trabajos son balcones, puertas y portones, esta es la fuente de ingreso para cubrir los gastos y la alimentación del hogar.
Actualmente está con deseos de comprar maquinaria para el taller, por lo que solicita un préstamo y realizar dicha compra entre las herramientas que desea adquirir es pulidor y cortador de hierro.
Con esta ayuda el estará en mejores condiciones para realizar sus trabajos e ir desarrollándose más en el mercado. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien, se preparen profesionalmente y para lograrlo quiere poner todo su empeño en el trabajo para que a través de este pueda realizar el sueño.
texts.en:
José Nehemías lives in El Divisadero, in Morazán department with his wife and three children.  He has a construction and metal shop.  Sometimes he works at home and other times he goes out to other peoples houses.  He makes balconies, internal doors and front doors.  This is his source of income and it covers his household expenses and provides food for his family.

He would currently like to buy machinery for his workshop which is why he is requesting a loan.  Amongst the tools he would like to buy are a polisher and a metal cutter.  With this help, he will be in a better position to do his work and develop himself in the market.  His dream is for his children to study and to prepare themselves professionally.  He would like to put all his effort into his work so that he can achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy tools: a polisher and a metal cutter

loans.name: Duo Solidario El Misperal Group

texts.es: DUO SOLIDARIO EL MISPERAL Doña Marta Lilia J.  A. ,  es una socia que desde varios años comenzó su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado local de su comunidad solo en los días de mercado, al pasar del tiempo conoció  a Fape y lleva cuatro ciclos trabajando  y ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad actualmente es la presidenta del banco comunal y vende frutas y verduras por mayor en el mercado minerva , al igual que doña Maricela  es una socia que se dedica a la venta de flores y arreglos florales  en el mercado donde amablemente sirve a sus clientes  dándoles diversos diseños de arreglos en su comunidad, aparte de eso se dedica a arreglos  florales para ocasiones especiales tales como boda y quince años y han logrado crecer gracias a la confianza que Fape les ha brindado.
texts.en:
Solidarity Group - El Misperal

Marta Lilia J. A. set up her business selling fruit and vegetables several years ago.   She sells in her local market on market days.  Over time, she came to hear about FAPE and she has now been working with them for four loan cycles.  She has been very responsible in making her loan repayments.  She is currently the president of her community bank and sells fruit and vegetables wholesale in Minerva market.

Maricela's business is selling flowers and flower arrangements in the market where she serves her customers in a very friendly way, providing them with different designs and arrangements.  She also makes flower arrangements for special occasions such as weddings and 15th birthday celebrations.  The two ladies have managed to grow their businesses thanks to the trust that FAPE has placed in them.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables. To sell flower arrangements

loans.name: Henry Francisco

texts.es:
Henry Francisco C.  C. tiene 21 años de edad. Es soltero vive con los abuelos en el  cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las blancas Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Henry Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Henry Francisco C.  C. is 21. He is single and lives with his grandparents in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He does not have any children.

The members of the V.R.C. 26 de Noviembre ["November 26th"] are located in the Las Blancas neighbourhood belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Henry Francisco has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for five years. He buys his products in Agripac and sells them in the market in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a car.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambat P. is 36 years old, and her husband, Mr. Each Chhom is 38 years old. They live along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. The couple has been growing flowers for almost twenty years. They have three daughters. Two are garment factory workers and another one is in school. 

Sambat is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her flower farm. In the photo she is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Osmar Silvino

texts.en:
Mr. Osmar is 31 years old and he is currently single.  He lives with his parents and he owns an auto repair shop.

He first started thanks to his father, from whom he learned the profession. Nowadays he has all the necessary work elements for any type of auto repair or maintenance work.  Seeing the need for service improvement, he went to the Foundation for help.

He requested a loan to get a new air compressor, as the one he has is almost obsolete.  Osmar is very thankful to the Foundation for the given opportunity, which will help him improve the service that he gives and get some advantage over the competition.

loans.use: buying an air compressor

loans.name: Hermes Gregorio

texts.es:
Herme Gregorio  de 58 años de edad es casado, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, es una persona respondable, humilde y lo mas importante es un trabajador permanente; labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde  hace  diecisiete años actualmente se desempeña como operario de limpieza, ha venido mejorando su vivienda con creditos mediante afodenic.  

Solicita la ayuda de Kiva ya que pretende repellar las paredes internas de su casa y la construccion de un cuarto de  4 mtros x 4mtrs y asi tener mas comodidad para su familia. 

Su mayor sueño es dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos que actualmente es la casa con buenas mejoras y que no les falte el pan de cada dia
texts.en:
Herme Gregorio is 58 years old and has two adult children.  He is a modest, responsible person who believes a permanent job is the most important thing in life.  He has worked for the City Hall of Juigalpa for 17 years as a janitor.  He's been able to make home improvements with the loans he's received through Afodenic.

He is requesting support from Kiva to water-proof the inside walls of his house and to build a 4 meter x 4 meter room so his family lives more comfortably.

His dream is for his children to receive a good inheritance, meaning the house with significant improvements, and food on the table everyday.

loans.use: To make home improvements; water-proof the inside walls

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en: Adolf is 40 years old.  He lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He hopes to be able to educate his children up to university.  He is a doctor who runs his own clinic which supplements his monthly salary. He has challenges in purchasing drugs due to limited funds and his dream is to own a pharmacy. Adolf is requesting a loan to purchase drugs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase drugs to sell

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en:
Erenia is 50 years old and married with seven children.

Erenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell.

Erenia has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from a piggery.

Erenia aspires to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham N., a 54-year-old married father of four children, has been selling household goods such as kettles, pails, basins and many other items for the past seven years in order to support his family. The business is quite successful, carrying goods that meet client demand, thereby generating a stable income that allows Ilham to improve the living conditions of his family and make his children happy. A successful client with one previous loan, he is now requesting 1400 AZN to enlarge the range of goods he carries. Ilham promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase more goods.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive Abigail S., ella tiene la edad de 41 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado se secundaria y es soltera.

Ella nos platica que hace mas de 4 años inicio atrabajar en su propio negocio de venta de refrescos y productos de bellesa de la marca Avon con sus amigas y vecinas de la comunidad, ella vende casa por casa, primero lleva sus catalagos a sus clientes, levanta un pedido, lo encarga a sus proveedores y posteriormente cuando llega el paquete lo entrega con sus clientas y recebe el pago por sus productos.

ella nos dice que espera que con esta credito su negocio cresca mas cada dia. Abigail necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos, catalogos, perfumeria y cosmeticos para posteriormente venderlos.

ella se encuentra muy agradecida con este prestamo que se le ha otorgado el cual le brindara la oportinidad de que su negocio creesca
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called Arroyo de Pita, which is known for being the only community for miles around that offers the possibility of obtaining a high school diploma. In this community lives Abigail S.. She is 41 years of age, studied until Year 9 at secondary school and is single.

Abigail tells us that she started her own business more than four years ago selling refreshments and Avon beauty products to her friends and neighbours in the community from door to door. First she brings her clients catalogues, then she takes their orders which she sends to the Avon providers and finally she delivers the cosmetics to her clients and receives payments for the products.

Abigail tells us that she hopes to use this loan to expand her business day by day. She needs this loan to purchase refreshments, catalogues, perfumes and cosmetics to resell.

Abigail is very grateful for the loan that she has been granted, which will give her the opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and refreshments

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi is married with a grown son. He lives in the small agricultural town of Gladkovka. Valeryi grows early spring vegetables: 6,000 tomatoes, 10,000 cabbage heads, 5,000 peppers, 5,000 eggplants and 5 tons of potatoes. Valeryi has been working in the sphere of agriculture for 20 years. He has invested about 150,000 Grivnyas in his business. 

Valeryi is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to invest in the purchase of seeds, plastic film and fertilizers, as well as to install a drip irrigation unit. He will do small repairs in his greenhouses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic film, fertilizers and install a drip irrigation unit

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her son’s vegetable sales business. He operates his business from his home and provides fresh seasonal vegetables to his customers. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables in bulk, which will enable him to meet the urgent needs of his customers and increase his sales.
Zarina’s husband operates a donkey cart and provides loading facilities to his customers. He is still very active at the age of 55 and provides quality services to his clients by dropping their goods at designated places. Zarina is the mother of four children. Her second son has a furniture sales business while her third son is an electrician by profession. Her daughter is eight years old and stays at home. Zarina wanted to educate her children but she was not able to do so due to financial constraints.
Her eldest son started his business six months ago. Zarina is confident that a loan investment will help him increase his profits and improve the financial condition of his business.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
Maria Cleofe tiene 33 años, es soltera vive con la hija. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es construir la casa.

Le gusta trabajar y pasar con la hija
texts.en:
Maria Cleofe is 33 years old. She is single and lives with her daughter. She lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios. 

This communal bank is called Narcisa de Jesus. It is located in the San Temistocles district in the Ventanas canton. This communal bank works with agricultural businesses with short term loans for planting corn and rice.

Maria works in agriculture, especially in the planting of corn and rice. She buys supplies in Ventanas every month and sells her products in the fair at the same location.

She is applying for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. The loan will help her economically to supply her necessities. She faces challenges such as pests and diseases in her crops and variations in the weather. Her dream is to construct a house.

She likes to work and spend time with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Unidas se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní. Este comite se encuentra en el primer ciclo, el mismo cuenta con diez integrantes, todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, son mujeres jefas de familia, que cada día se esfuerzan al máximo para darle a sus hijos una vida decorosa y digna.
Doña Gricelda, es una señora muy trabajadora que se encarga de la cría de animales, posee un grupo reducido de ellos y sueña con algún día tener una granja con muchos animales.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mas crías de animales, ademas de los alimentos que estos consumirán. tiene las esperanzas puestas en el crédito ya que le sera de gran ayuda frente a los proyectos que ella pretende emprender.
texts.en:
The 'Unidas' (United) committee was formed when several neighbors from the same community, in the city of Santaní, joined together as a group.  This committee is in its first loan cycle with ten [female] members who are all very hard-working and tenacious.  They are heads of their respective families and every day they work as hard as they can to provide their children with a decent and respectable life.

Gricelda is a very hard-working lady who raises animals.  She owns a reduced group of animals and she dreams of some day owning a farm with a lot of animals.

Gricelda is requesting this loan to buy more animals to raise as well as feed for them.  She has her hopes placed in this loan as it will be a great help for the projects that she plans to undertake.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise as well as balanced feed for them

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is not currently in school.  

Jackie has a beauty salon business, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Jackie has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jackie hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself like buying new clothes.  

In the future, Jackie hopes to expand her business into a bigger beauty salon. Jackie is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her to be hard working and know that she has to repay the money.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: 61 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Binh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattL.. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattL.-feed.

Binh is 49 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Binh is the group leader of the 61 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is Binh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Binh has been involved in this business for 5 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Binh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own and to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle-feed

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married, and has five children. 

Kazem has been an owner of a jewelry shop since 2006. He has a lot of experience making jewelry designs, a good reputation, and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. 

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory. He aims to make more money to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
Amie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Amie was born in Kambia town, 45 years ago. She is married to an imam and the couple has 4 children who are attending secondary schools. 

For 15 years now, Amie has been selling cooked food and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). This is the first loan that Amie and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Amie will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy 50 gallons of palm-oil and 5 bags of rice.

loans.use: to buy 50 gallons of palm-oil and 5 bags of rice.

loans.name: Kinampet

texts.en:
Kinampet is 43 years old, married with three children, two are in school. He does mixed farming rearing sheep, goats and is also a wheat farmer which he has been doing for the past eight years.

He learned about KADET LTD through KADET staff. He paid his first loan successfully and applied for the second loan which he plans to spend partly in farming to buy seeds and to buy two goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

He hopes to make a profit and use the anticipated funds to educate his children. He dreams to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and  two goats to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife. He has 14 years of experience working in the construction field. After gaining the needed experience, he decided to start working on a freelance basis managing houses in his village and its surroundings. He is a very hard-working person specializing in wall foliage work. Today, Mahmoud is applying for a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more wood for his work. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening a construction office and working directly with construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his work

loans.name: Elisée

texts.fr:
Elisée est né au Rwanda et il a 26 ans. Il est célibataire et il prend soin de sa mère. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans d’université. 

Elisée est avocat et voudrait aussi faire le taxi voiture. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour lui aider à acheter une taxi voiture. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de mettre le prix de transport adoptable. Dans les prochaines années, Elisée voudrait être transporteur dans le son district ou ailleurs. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le minerval de ses petits frères.
texts.en:
Elisée was born in Rwanda 26 years ago. He is single and takes care of her mother. He attended university for four years. He's a lawyer and would like to also become a taxi driver.

Elisée is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB, in order to help him buy a taxi car. His strategy for growth is to offer affordable taxi ride prices.

In the forthcoming years, he would like to provide transport services in his district or somewhere else. With his profits, he intends to pay the school fees of his younger brothers.

loans.use: to buy a taxi car

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married. She has six children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 27 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and retailing rice and feeds.

Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 49 years old and lives in Makawa Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. Cristina has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase more ingredients for her viand business. 
 
Cristina has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her viand business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años de edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad
Son tres años que viene trabajando con los prestamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, lleva varios años trabajando con estos productos y le está yendo bien.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 1 crema para mano, 3 jaboncillos, 1 loción para cara,  2 talcos, 3 perfumes, 2 champú, 2 enjuagues, 2 rubores.
Su trabajo le dio muchas satisfacciones, aparte de darle ganancias le dio buenas amistades, porque todo este tiempo conoció a muchas personas a las que aprecia como si fueran su familia.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de pertenecer a su familia y darle los créditos con tanta facilidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 'Mujeres con Futuro' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 56 years old, separated, and has three grown-up children.

Rosa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  Her business is selling beauty products through a catalog.  She has been working with these products for several years and things are going well.

Rosa will use her new loan for 1,500 soles to buy one lot of hand cream, three lots of soap, one lot of face lotion, two lots of talcum powder, three lots of perfume, two lots of shampoo, two lots of mouthwash and two lots of blusher.

Rosa's work brings her a lot of satisfaction.  In addition to the profits she makes she also makes good friends because, over time, she has come to know many people who she values as if they were family members.

Rosa is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity they have given her to belong to their family and for the loans that they have given her so easily.

loans.use: to buy 1 lot of hand cream, 3 lots of soap, 1 lot of face lotion, 2 lots of talcum powder, 3 lots of perfume, etc.

loans.name: Mirna Marisol

texts.es:
Mirna vive con su esposo y tres hijos es casada, dueña D. una venta D. pan dulce, francés y D.  calzado, trabaja todos los días D. 4:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. desD. hace diez años, este negocio lo fundo por iniciativa propia .
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. calzado y ropa para salir a vender D. forma ambulante, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar más su negocio y poder obtener mayores ganancias económicas.
El proposito D. Mirna es mejorar su negocio para con ello mejorar las ganancias y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirna lives with her husband and three children. She is married and is the owner of a French pastries business and also sells footwear. She works every day from 4 a.m. until 7 p.m. as she has done for ten years. She founded this business by her own initiative. 

She is seeking a loan for the purchase of footwear and clothing to sell as a street vendor. This purchase will help her further expand her business and bring in greater financial profits. 

Mirna's aim is to improve her business so as to improve the earnings and support her children.

loans.use: to purchase footwear and clothing.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is 46 years old, married and has children.  Her eldest son operates a cosmetics selling business and earns a good profit.  He also has some good clients. 

Her husband sells balloons of different shapes which attracts many children towards him.  He has good sales everyday.  

Bashiraan also supports her husband financially by making Pranday (ornament used to tie up hairs and it is very popular among women) that sells for a very good price. 

Besides her business, she also manages her household very well. 

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son, for his cosmetic selling business.  With the loan, he will buy cosmetics such as eye shadow, mascara, nail polish, etc. in bulk. 

He has operated his business for many years and Bashiraan is hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as eye shadow, mascara, nail polish, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang is 40 years old and a mother of 3 school-aged children. She has been operating a fish selling business in a local market of Baray district, and she typically earns around $2.00 per day. She also takes some time to look after her piglets at home. Last month there was a small flood in her commune and there are many difficulties for people there. But now everything seems to be going well, so Mrs. Seang wants to take this opportunity to begin another business for more income. She will sell sugar cane juice for students in front of a local school from her motorcycle (this motorcycle is connected with a trailer at the side and has a machine for squeezing sugar cane as well).  However, Mrs. Seang has inadequate capital to buy this kind of motor vehicle to start up this new business.  She is turning to Kiva’s funders for support. She is very happy and thankful to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle (this motorcycle is connected with a trailer at the side, has a machine for squeezing sugar cane as well).

loans.name: Lanibelle

texts.en:
Lanibelle is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Lanibelle has a shop that sells coconuts and bananas. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Lanibelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lanibelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Patouani

texts.fr:
Patouani est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un réparateur de radio et télévision. Elle a 4 enfants.
Patouani travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation et d’articles en plastique pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Patouani a requis son 3ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation et des articles en plastique. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Patouani voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de financer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Patouani is 38 years old. She is married to a radio and TV repairman, and they have four children.

Patouani has been a reseller since 2002. She sells food products and plastic wares from her home. She buys her merchandise in Lomé. She works alone, and for the time being, she is not facing any particular difficulties. 

Patouani is seeking a third loan from WAGES to purchase food products and plastic goods. She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Patouani would like to expand her business. She will use the profits earned to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy general food products and plastic wares for resale.

loans.name: 05.12.44 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòe has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to seto purchase sticky rice to make donuts to sell. Hòe has been involved in this business for 5 years. Hòe supports no dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that Hòe faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hòe is 60 years old and she is married with 3 children. Hòe is the group leader of the 05.12.44 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

In 2011, Hòe joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hòe has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hòe hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sticky rice to make donuts to sell

loans.name: Xinh

texts.en:
Xinh and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City.  She is 39 years old and has two children.  Xinh and her husband have been earning a living by operating a general store from the front of her house for the past ten years.  They sell a variety of goods, such as sugar, candies, basic household necessities, beverages and rice.

Xinh would like to borrow money in order to expand her business by purchasing more products in bulk for the coming holiday season.  She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more products in bulk for the coming holiday season.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 67 years old and widowed. She has a business buying and selling mud crabs and lobsters in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs and water buffalo and farming rice. Aracel is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more mud crabs and lobsters for resale. She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested a new loan to further build and expand her businesses.

Araceli has been sustaining her business activities through 10 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more crabs and lobsters for resale

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
He is from Jabrail region and he settled with his 2 children in Absheron region Khirdalan town.He has had his business for 5 years ago and it allows his to support to his family.
This 41-year is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Jabrail.
He borrowed the amount of $400 to renovate  for repairing the tyre the necessary equipments:compressor,furnace .He has been engagaed in this business for 5 years. The second time he borrowed the loan amount of $800 and with this loan he enlarged and renovated the area of his shop.

loans.use: To organize the buying and selling of the used and the new tyres

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Taraiya would like to buy 3 steers

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda is 51 years old and has 8 children. Her husband produces coal, which he later sells to the community. She has a small store in her house where she sells candies, sodas, sugar and salt among other items. Hermelinda hopes that with the loan she'll make the store bigger and she'll be able to provide a greater variety of products. She belongs to the group Nubes 8.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

HERMELINDA TIENE 51 AÑOS, CASADA , 8 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DEL CARBON QUE DESPUES VENDE ENTRE LA COMUNIDAD.ELLA TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA EN SU CASA DONDE VENDE GOLOSINAS, BEBIDAS, AZUCAR, SAL , ESPERA CON EL CREDITO AGRANDAR SU TIENDA Y ABASTECERLA CON MAS PRODUCTOS. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO NUBES 8 .

loans.use: COMERCIANTE

loans.name: Petrono

texts.en:
Petrono Pelicó P. is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Petrono rents her little plot of just a single cuerda for about US$158/year, and grows ornamental flowers like daisies and carnations. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in only a small portion of her income, so she also works extensively in the fields of others to support herself and her 16-year-old.

Petrono, 32, is separated from her husband and has just the one son, who did complete fourth grade. Petrono herself never had any schooling, cannot read or write, and speaks only a smattering of Spanish, since day-to-day conversations are carried out in her native Quiché language.

Petrono dreams of somehow prospering in her business, renting larger plots of land, and maybe buying her own land someday. She thinks that next year she may be able to rent two cuerdas of land and double her income.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase sedd, fertilizer, and pesticides for flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
Nasir is 26 years old and a resident of Aghsu region, located in the central part of Azerbaijan. He works as a taxi driver in Aghsu Town, using his own car. He works inside the town but also sometimes goes long distances such as to Baku and other regions.

Nasir needs to buy new tyres for his taxi. As he has little money of his own, he has applied to Normicro's Khachmaz branch to borrow US$ 500 to purchase new tyres and to make some repairs on the taxi as well.

loans.use: To buy new tyres

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz (her husband is pictured) has a fruit orchard which she has been tending for 5 years. This 48-year-old woman has three children and lives in Khachmaz town. Now Firangiz's family needs a loan of $600 to buy fertilizer and weed control products for their orchard.

loans.use: Firangiz would like to buy weed control and fertilizer.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer T. owns and operates a small footwear stand in the bazaar located in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. (His father is pictured). He is 30 years old and is married with two children. Azer has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Normicro proving that he is a customer who can be trusted. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 so that he can increase and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify his inventory.

loans.name: Abduvalieva

texts.en: Abduvalieva B. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast,) Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. Mrs. Abduvalieva B. applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended herself as a serious and responsible client. Her business stability and income increase helped her to return  the previous loan and to improve her business situation. Mrs. Abduvalieva B. is experienced in business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge in livestock because she has been engaged in the livestock business from her early years when she helped  her mother on the farm in looking after cows and sheep. Now it is the family business that brings the general income. She is engaged in  livestock raising and selling and  milk production. In time she dreams of owning a pedigree milk-cow  that would ensure the milk products making and selling. Now Mrs. Abduvalieva B. requests the loan of $425  business development that will permit her to increase significantly the family income and to make a milk-cow purchase.

loans.use: for  business development and the further milk-cow purchase

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
For more than 12 years, Miguel has worked as an educator, teaching primary school-aged children at the Rene Shick State School, at a monthly salary of approximately US$130. For him, teaching is a labor of love and a way to shape his community's children.

Since his salary doesn't stretch very far or even cover basic expenses for providing food and clothing for his family, Miguel works evenings, three to five times a week, as a chauffeur. It pays enough to help him provide for his wife and young daughter.

The purpose of this loan is to improve and enclose the kitchen of his small and humble house which is very run down. Miguel doesn't have the resources to finish the kitchen but with your help he hopes to go on improving his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Miguel Ángel desde más de 12 años trabaja como Maestro enseñando a niños de primaria en el Colegio Estatal Rene Shick, con un salario mensual aproximadamente de ciento treinta dólares (U$130.00) mensuales, su oficio es un desempeño de amor y entrega a la formación de los niños de su comunidad.

En vista que su humilde salario no le cubre para la totalidad de sus necesidades ni alcanza para cubrir la canasta básica de alimentos ni vestuario de sus familias, este Maestro trabaja por las tardes como chofer de una casa particular de tres a cinco veces por semana, con lo cual se ayuda para completar las necesidades de su familia conformada por su esposa e hija pequeña.

El objeto de este crédito es la de mejorar y cerrar la cocina de su pequeña y humilde vivienda, la cual se encuentra en malas condiciones y por la falta de recursos económicos no ha podido continuar la construcción de su cocina, pero con su esfuerzo desea ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Buy building materials to improve kitchen.

loans.name: Maimuna's Mbuyuni Group

texts.en:
Maimuna is 22 years old and is a single woman. Maimuna owns a small shop, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Maimuna has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in "bites"-selling, cloth, and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Lelia

texts.es:
Doña Lelia, in conjunction with her older children, has installed an auto body in her home to lend her services to the hundreds of motorists in the city. Besides the repair services that they offer in this small space, they also take all their tools to the place that requires their knowledge. Due to this, they have let their workshop go a bit and have decided together to agree to remain in this small space for a time to improve their area and to bring a greater character of a business to it.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Doña Lelia en sociedad con sus hijos mayores ha instalado en casa una vulcanizadora para prestar sus servicios a los centenares de conductores de su ciudad.Además de los servicios de reparación que brindan en este pequeño espacio se trasladan con todos sus implementos hasta el lugar en el que requieren de sus conocimientos, a causa de este hecho han descuidado un poco su taller y han decidido en común acuerdo mantenerse en este espacio por un pequeño espacio de tiempo para mejorar sus instalaciones y otorgarle mayor carácter empresarial.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to get more and better tools for her work space

loans.name: Morn Yuos Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn Y. is the leader of this group in Koh Khtom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. The 35-year-old subsistence farmer has five children, four of whom are studying while the fifth is yet too young to attend school. In September of 2007, her youngest child got malaria, the treatment of which incurred unforeseen expenses. Mrs. Morn Y.’ husband, Mr. Kimsan Mork, is a farmer and pig breeder who also sometimes buys firewood to resell to the villagers.

Earning a small yearly income because she owns a small piece of land, Mrs Morn Y. now wants to expand her rice plantation and is therefore seeking a loan to buy additional land.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina C. is a member of the Village Bank Orquídeas.

Delfina is married, is 33 years old, and has 2 children. Delfina and her husband sell natural medicines for different illnesses. They make the medicines themselves and do this as a type of out-patient clinic using a wheelbarrow in the Nery García market. Delfina sells the best natural products that can be bought in Lima.

Delfina needs a loan of 3000 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of capsules, herbs, and sugar.

Delfina's dreams are to have a well-established store and that her children become professionals in some field.

loans.use: To purchase capsules, herbs, and sugar.

loans.name: In

texts.en: In M., 64, is a widow who lives in Siem Reap with her son's family. She takes care of the house and the grandchildren, but she would like to help the family increase its daily income. She has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her son. She believes that if her son has a new motorbike he can operate his own taxi service, earning more income for the family. Inflation has been very difficult for many Cambodians over the last year and many people have been looking for ways to diversify their income and start new businesses. In M. believes that this investment will allow her family to increase its income and also create a better sense of stability. She wants to help out her son's family in any way she can and looks forward to seeing the results of this loan.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to operate a taxi service

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Jayanti K. lives in an extended family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and three daughters in a village called Khogana Dobato. All three of her daughters are enrolled in school, in grades 12, 8, and 6 respectively.

Both Mrs. Jayanti K. and her husband Mr. Ram Hari K. are farmers in Khogana Dobato. They mostly prefer to grow seasonal vegetables on their land because they do not have modern technology. They sell their vegetables at the local market in the morning and in the evening.

Now Mrs. K. is seeking a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Mr. Hin S. is a cow breeder and fisherman in Preak Takeo Village in Kandal Province. His second business of fishing has an obstacle now, as he does not have enough fish nets. So, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish nets, which he hopes will help him gather more fish and improve his living conditions.
