His wife, Mrs. Tum Saroeurn, is a farmer who can earn a small income with her plantation revenue. Mr. Hin S. is 50 years old and the father of seven children, four of whom are employed in different business activities, while the three remaining are attending high school. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish nets

loans.name: Fayzinisso

texts.ru: Сафарова Файзиниссо жительница  города Вахдат.Возраст 47 лет,замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж клиентки работает таксистом на своей машине. Работает шофером более 30 лет. Так как бензин подорожал,ее муж хочет купить газовое оборудование  для машины.Для чего они решили взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fayzinisso S. lives in the city of Vakhdat. She is 47 years old, married and has 6 children. Her husband is a cab driver. He uses their private car as a taxi. He has been in the business for over 30 years. With fuel prices rising, Fayzinisso’s husband would need to obtain a loan for purchasing fuel. The family plans to repay the loan in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucía, de 40 años de edad, domiciliada en el Barrio Cerro Corá de la Ciudad de Itá, está casada con el Señor César con quien tiene dos hijos, de 19 y 10 años de edad. De profesión artesana en tejido, dejó de ejercer tal profesión a causa del viaje de su hermana a España y ya no pudo comercializar sus productos lo cual hacía a través de la misma, quedando solo el ingreso del marido, quien es empleado del Frigorífico Frigomer para el sustento de la familia.

La situación era cada vez más insostenible ya que el hijo mayor ingresó en la carrera de Arquitectura de la Universidad Nacional de Asunción, aumentando de esta manera cada vez más los gastos.

Fue así que decidió montar otro negocio, hoy día cuenta con una despensa donde la misma trabaja con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya para ampliar su negocio y de esta manera acrecentar el ingreso económico posibilitando a los hijos seguir con sus estudios.

Toda la familia se encuentra agradecida con la Fundación por brindarles la oportunidad de trabajar gracias a la aprobación del crédito solicitado.

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en arroz, harina, azúcar, fideo, etc. con el fin de surtir un poco más su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucia, age 40, lives in the Cerro Corá neighborhood in the city of Itá. She is married to Mr. César, with whom she has 2 children, ages 19 and 10. She used to knit traditional clothing, but she stopped doing so because her sister went to Spain and as a result, she was no longer able to sell her handmade products because her sister was the one who helped her with that. She was left only with her husband’s income; he works for the Frigorífico Frigomer Company in order to support the family.

Their situation grew more and more unsustainable because the eldest son began studying architecture in the Universidad Nacional de Asunción (National University of Asunción), which further increased their expenses.

This was how she decided to start another business. Today she runs a general store with the aim of improving her family’s living conditions. She has decided to trust in Fundación Paraguaya in order to expand her business, and as a consequence, increase her income so that her children can continue with their studies.

The entire family expresses gratitude for the Fundación for giving them the opportunity to work thanks to the loan approval.

The loan being requested will be invested in rice, flour, sugar, noodles, etc. so that she can increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, rice, noodles, bread, etc.

loans.name: Ndongo

texts.fr: Ndongo est agé de 46 ans il est marié et oére de famille .Pour échapper aux difficultés au monde rural dues au deficit pluviometrique, il a quitté depuis cinq (05) ans son village pour venir s' installer dans la périphérie de la ville de Mbour avec sa famille.Pour gagner sa vie chaque matin il charge sa charette de paille d'arachide pour le vendre à travers la ville .Avec la fin des récoltes ,il sollicite un pret pour s'approvisionner en marchandise a bon prix.
texts.en:
Ndongo is 46 years old, married and the father of a family. To escape the difficulties of a rural life plagued by a shortage of rainfall, five years ago he left his village and with his family relocated to the outskirts of the town of Mbour. To earn a living, each morning Ndongo loads up his wagon with peanut straw and sells it around town. As the end of the harvest approaches, he is requesting a loan in order to stock up on straw at a good price.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Dina Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Bienestar (“Well-being”) Village Bank. She is 39 years old and married with two sons. She sells clothing, Avon cosmetics, and perfume. She and her husband also own a car that they use as a taxi in the city of Ayacucho. She started selling Avon products three years ago, and began selling clothing just recently.

Mercedes is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy women’s clothing for the Christmas season. Her goal for the future is to buy a bus to use for inter-provincial passenger transport.

loans.use: Buy women's clothing for the Christmas season

loans.name: Shazia Ghulam Hussain Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is a 25-year-old married lady. She owns a two-room brick house in a city named Vehari and has lived with her family for the past 3 years. Her husband's name is G. H., who has a quilt selling business. Shazia baji makes quilts and her husband goes to market to sell them. They both have been working in this business for the past 20 years. She is applying for a loan to buy material (thread and cloth) to expand her quilt-making and selling business.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Rukhsana baji, Naseem baji and Ayesha baji each want a loan to buy material (thread and cloth) for their quilt-making and selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for quilt making and selling

loans.name: Tolib

texts.en:
H. Tolib is 48 years old and lives in Istaravshan town with his wife works as a shopkeeper to help with the living expenses.Tolib has four sons who also help him. For thirty years Tolib has worked his land which produces potato, tomato and cucumber. His greatest dream is to be able to establish more crops to that he can leave equal parts to his children. He started farming as a child, with his parents teaching him. He is requesting financing to  buy supplies for his crops in order to get a good yield and sell more in the market.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Channtum

texts.en:
Mrs. Channtum S., 27, and her husband, Mr. Chaiya Chaum, 26, who live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2004 and have two young daughters. 

Channtum has been selling fruit for two years; she buys them on contract from villagers for resale in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a fisherman since 1999, a profession he learned from his brother. Channtum is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a trailer to carry fruit to sell and to buy mangoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and to buy mango for resale.

loans.name: Merta Nadi Group

texts.id:
Kelompok Merta Nadi sudah mendapatkan pinjaman modal usaha dari Dinari sebanyak dua kali dan mereka merasakan manfaat yang baik dari kerja sama tersebut. Anggota sebelumnya berjumlah sebelas orang dan sekarang dua diantaranya berhenti karena merasa sudah cukup mampu dalam mengelola usahanya dengan modal yang dimiliki sendiri. Dalam situasi yang serba sulit saat ini kelompok juga merasakan dampaknya, baik itu dari kenaikan harga pakan maupun harga bibit, sehingga mereka harus berusaha keras mengatur keuangan dalam mengelola usahanya supaya tidak mengalami kerugian. Untuk mempertahankan keuntungan yang mereka peroleh selama ini yang berkisar Rp 600.000 sampai Rp 800.000 dalam waktu enam bulan, mereka mensiasati dengan cara mencari waktu yang tepat saat menjual babi yaitu pada waktu menjelang hari raya keagamaan dimana harga babi biasanya lebih tinggi daripada hari-hari biasa. Dengan cara inilah kelompok mampu mempertahankan kestabilan usaha mereka. 
	Melihat  dari situasi yang ada pada saat ini dimana tidak semua anggota bisa mandiri menjalankan usaha dengan modal sendiri maka kelompok memutuskan untuk tetap melanjutkan kerja sama dengan Dinari, yaitu dengan mengikuti program ternak babi dengan jangka waktu enam bulan dengan pembayaran dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman, dengan harapan usaha bisa lebih berkembang dan sedikit demi sedikit memupuk modal dari keuntungan yang diperoleh sehingga bisa mandiri pada suatu saat nanti.
texts.en:
The Merta Nadi group had already received venture-financing loan from Dinari twice and they derived great benefit from this co-operation. Previously the members were 11 people and now two among them stopped because felt already able to manage their venture with their own funding. In this precarious situation, at this moment the group feels the impact, whether from the increase in cost of supplies or cost of piglets, thus requiring stringent changes in managing the venture’s finances so as not to incur losses. To maintain the profit they already attained till now of fluctuating from Rp.600.000 till Rp.800.000 in the time of 6 months, they strategize with ways to find the precise time to sell the pig that is during the religious festival when the price of pork is usually higher than ordinary day. With this method the group is able to maintain the stability of their venture. Viewing the current situation where not all members is independently able to operate venture with their own funding thus the group decided to continue to work with Dinari, that is by following the pig rearing program for a period of 6 months with the repayment occurring at the end of the loan period, with the hope that the venture will develop and gradually nurturing the funding from the gain earned until they become self-sufficient at a later time.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao S., 28, is married to Maly, 23 and they live in the rural area of Banteay Meanchey Province. The young couple reside with their two teenage children who are enrolled in the local public school.

They make a daily income by carving marble from the mountains, located far from their house. They sell to the buyers who come to purchase at their home. But the income is not enough for the family.

Mr. Mao S. would like an $800 loan in order to buy speakers, a generator and musical instruments. They will use them to generate more revenue. Mr. S.'s wife is pictured because he was not available.

loans.use: To buy a generator, speakers and musical instruments

loans.name: Mirna Estela

texts.es:
Es Casada y tiene dos hijos.

La situacion de esta señora era la  busqueda de un ingreso extra, pero el salir a trabajar , no era muy conveniente ya que no queria descuidar a sus hijos, muy interesada en la invitacion de una amiga, acepta entrar a las ventas por catalogo.

ahora ella requiere comprar mas productos de los que ya tiene para poder ofrecer, variedad y calidad.

sus clientes le demandan mas productos, y hora requiere de cierta cantidad de dinero para comprar todo lo que se le solicitan.

Junto con esposo, trabajan para darle mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, y este negocio de las ventas por catalogo le ayuda mucho ya que no tiene que salir  de su hogar, y asi ella pueda  estar al pendiente de su familia.
texts.en:
She is married and has two children. She needed extra income but leaving home to go work was not convenient and she didn’t want to leave her children unattended. She was very interested in a friend’s invitation to join catalogue sales. Now she needs to purchase more of the items she’s already offering so she can provide more variety and quality. Her customers are asking for more items, so she requires a certain amount of money to purchase everything being requested. Together with her husband they work to provide a better quality of life for their children, and the catalogue sales business is very beneficial, as she doesn’t have to leave home and she can take care of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara B. is fifty–four years old and married with seven children, four sons and three daughters. Some of the children are in senior high while others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Ajara trades in dried peppers. She distributes to retailers and food vendors in her community. Ajara buys her dried peppers from nearby markets at a good price. She is also into food vending. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Ajara is hopeful of expanding her business and wants to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Lidia

texts.es:
Carmen Lidia U. B. es una señora de 51 años de edad, la cual vive con su pareja, un hijo y una nieta de 7 años. 

La comunidad en la cual vive doña Carmen se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a una hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable debido a las fuertes lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Años atrás, cuando no existían actividades productivas viables, muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajo en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Doña Carmen instaló su negocio, una “soda” (un pequeño restaurante de comida criolla) en su propia casa. Dice que de esta forma puede ayudar con los gastos en su casa y que además se siente feliz de tener su propio negocio ya que ha tenido muy  buena aceptación en su comunidad. Ella comenta que el mayor  atractivo de su soda son los tamales, los cuales son una comida muy típica de Costa Rica. 
Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢500.000(quinientos mil colones) para comprar más mercadería que pueda vender,  hacer más grande el negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus vecinos y turistas que pasen por la zona. Específicamente comprará una máquina de moler maíz, una olla extra grande para cocinar los Tamales, un recipiente grande para batir la masa, una canasta plástica para vender el producto y los ingredientes necesarios para su elaboración. 

Doña Carmen  es socia de Asociación de Productores del Sauce de Santa Teresita, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Carmen Lidia U. B. is 51 years old and lives with her partner, her son and her 7 year old granddaughter.

The community in which Ms. Carmen lives is called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the Cartago province. It is a small rural community of approximately two thousand inhabitants. The residents work in milk production and coffee planting. The terrain is uneven and much of the land is tropical rainforest. The community has a very picturesque landscape that combines the tropical forest with two beautiful lagoons, coffee plantations and dairies. El Sauce is located approximately an hour and a half by bus from Turrialba, the city and commercial center. Unfortunately, several times a year the road becomes impassible due to the heavy rains that batter the region. This is, without a doubt, one of community’s main challenges.

Years ago, when no viable productive activities existed, many people opted to leave and look for work in Turrialba or in banana plantations located in the Atlantic region of Costa Rica. Presently coffee and milk prices have improved so residents are figuring out how to invest in projects in the same area and this way avoid having to move.

Ms. Carmen started her business, a small restaurant with Creole food called a “soda”, in her own house. She says that this way she can help with household expenses and she also feels happy to have her own business because she has been very well received in the community. Carmen commented that the biggest attraction in her restaurant are the tamales, which are a very typical food in Costa Rica.

Right now she needs a loan of 500,000 colones (Costa Rican Currency) to purchase more merchandise that she can sell, to increase her business and offer better service to her neighbors and the tourists who pass through the area. More specifically, she will buy a machine to grind corn, an extra large pot to cook tamales in, a large container to mix the dough in, a plastic basket to sell the product, and the ingredients necessary for its production.

Ms. Carmen is a member of the Productores del Sauce de Santa Teresita Association, one of the 100 member groups of the EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and with it she hopes to grow on a personal and economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of utensils and supplies to make Tamales.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Z. Dilbar is 42 years old. She is married and has 3 children. The elder daughter is already married and the two younger children are still living with the parents. The husband of Dilbar is not earning much money. In order to help her husband, and to support her family, Dilbar has been running her business already for 2 years. She is selling household appliances with the help of her daughter (pictured). All the equipment is imported from Uzbekistan and other countries. The business generates a significant income for the family, allowing improvement of their living conditions. Today, Dilbar requests 3000 Somoni. She is going to purchase new household appliances for expanding the variety of goods that she has for sale. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new appliances for selling.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita R. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 28 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Esterlita owns and operates a food market, primarily selling vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Esterlita is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new vegetables to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay for the tuition of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new vegetables to expand her product offering

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly A. is from the village of Zone 1B, Del Carmen Iligan City. She is 56, married and has 4 adult children. Beverly owns & operates a business selling beauty products and medicinal products from companies such as Avon, Natasha and Vita Plus. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly is requesting 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family's basic needs and supplement their income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 1B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou B. is from the town of Aloran. He is 32 years old. Marilou is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a hog raising  business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Marilou has been engaged in his business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Marilou from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business . 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Arodi

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Arodi C. le está haciendo falta un cuarto más que es para su hijo ya que la familia está creciendo y necesita más espacio.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material para la construcción ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora, en tiempo adicional a su trabajo. 
El es empleado de una compañía de compañía de trasportes en el departamento de empleado general esté es el ingreso que el tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte será destinada para el pago del crédito. El desea que su hijo tengo su propio cuarto y espacio en el casa.
texts.en:
Arodi C.’s house needs one more room for his son. His family is growing and needs more space. He is asking for this loan to be able to buy construction materials. He will take charge of making the improvement with extra time at his work. He is a general employee of a transportation company. This is the income he has for his family. Part of it will be to pay for the loan. He wishes for his son to have his own room and space in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in the back part of the house

loans.name: Verly

texts.en:
Verly is a food snack vendor in Cebu Village, San Isidro, Isabela. According to her, she is generating a net income of PHP 300 each week, which she puts towards her family's daily basic needs. In order to develop her business, Verly is seeking the assistance of KIVA lenders. She would like to borrow the amount of PHP 5,000 to reinvest into her business to increase her daily income.

Verly is married to Robertson Sr., and the couple is blessed with five children. Her eldest daughter is married, while the other four are still young and attending school. The couple is doing everything to support their children's education. Verly wants to provide her children with the best that she can afford because they are her treasures in life. She is praying that they may somehow be able to overcome whatever challenges that they face in their lives.

loans.use: To reinvest into her snack foods vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He want to completed his stocks

loans.name: Wael's Group

texts.en:
Wael is a 32-year-old married man with one child. In 2008 he decided to open his own computer and phone shop after six years of experience in this field. 

Wael is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a new desk chair for his shop.

loans.use: To buy a new desk chair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase storage facilities for her business

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra G. est mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH où elle a bénéficié de 15 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien remboursé. Elle développe une activité de petit commerce en vendant du mil, de l'arachide et des haricots séchés. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diarra G. is married and the mother of seven children. She is 53 years old. Diarra is a member of Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH where she has benefited from 15 loans, which she has always repaid. She's developing a small business selling millet, peanuts, and dried beans. Her profits enable her to take part in supporting her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make her business profitable

loans.name: Dengala Sibali Topista Group

texts.en: S. Topista is a hardworking business woman and a representative of her group. She is forty years old and married with ten children; four of her children are going to school, and she is taking care of two dependents. She runs a retail shop that she has been operating for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase essential items, such as sugar, soap, and salt, so she can increase her sales and profits. Her future hope is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase essential items such as sugar, soap, and salt

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 49 year old married woman living in Hasbaya with her husband and their six children. Nadia has been working in agriculture since 1992. She owns livestock and produces dairy products and cheese. She also plants wheat, lentils, olives, chick peas, and peaches. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a cow to increase her livestock and her productivity. This is her second cycle and she paid her previous loan on time which helped her increase her stock. Nadia is special in her work because she is an active woman who has a clean workplace, and she suits her clients' needs. Her customers are traders in her region. Nadia is planning to expand her business by purchasing another plot of land so that she can plant more.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en: Rogelia V. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 24 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Rogelia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Rogelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying electric driers, hair extensions, and more cosmetics

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Mrs. Norn S. lives in Ampov Prey Pir village in Kandal province. She is 69 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Sien Sou, are grocers in the local village who are able to earn a little money to support their family living.

However hard this family tries to work with their business, they are not able to earn enough income. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Norn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell to expand their business.

Mrs. Norn S. has no children. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Adrián Natividad

texts.es: Adrián Natividad B. de 37 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales asisten a la escuela del lugar en el que viven. Adrián es un hombre muy responsable quien de lunes a domingo sale a trabajar por el bienestar de su familia. Él se dedica a la venta de relojes, baterías y repuestos para estos; así mismo comercializa accesorios para el cabello, cremas, talcos, y ropa. Todo esto lo comercializa en su casa con la ayuda de su esposa, ya que el trabaja todo el día ofreciendo sus productos de forma ambulante por las calles y cantones de San Miguel, esto le permite obtener mayores ganancias, lo cual es de mucha importancia para él ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta. Adrián solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder aumentar la cantidad de productos, y de esta manera poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Cada día Adrián debe esforzarse al máximo, debido a que sus ganancias son diarias de lo cual debe utilizar en gran parte para los gastos del hogar, quedándole poco para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Adrián Natividad B., age 37, lives in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife, who dedicates herself to the household chores, and their four children. The children go to the school in the area where they live. Adrián is a very responsible man who goes to work Monday through Sunday for his family’s well-being. He sells watches, batteries, and replacement parts for watches. At the same time he sells hair accessories, creams, powder, and clothes. He sells all of this in his house with his wife’s help. He works all day offering his products as a traveling salesman in the streets and cantons of San Miguel. This allows him to get greater earnings. This income is very important to him because it is the only source of income that he has. Adrián is requesting a loan to be able to increase the quantity of products he has. This way he will be able to offer his customers greater variety. Each day Adrián needs to put forth his maximum effort because he needs to use most of his daily earnings for the household expenses. Little is left to invest in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, watches, and hair accessories

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia M. is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family with her buy and sell rice business. She lives in Brgy Tagbino Vallahermoso, Negros Occidental with her 49-year-old husband, Gregorio, who works as a farmer and habal-habal driver (a single motorcycle used for transportation especially in a mountainous area).  They have four children who are between 18-29 years old. Two of them work, one is still a student and one has a family.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her buy and sell of rice business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.

Abundia is now borrowing PHP 26,000 so that she can expand her buy and sell rice business. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Abundia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Edison Emilio

texts.es:
Edison O. de 24 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

El es chofer de un almacén de lunes a viernes pero por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio Edison compro $ 10.00 en pulseras y artesanías esto le genero ganancias y decidió que este iba a ser el negocio que tanto había estado esperando. 

En la actualidad el sigue siendo chofer pero trabaja los fines de semana y feriado vendiendo pulseras y artesanías así el tiene un ingreso adicional para sus gastos personales. Vende pulseras a $ 0.5, cadenas a $ 1.00 y anillos a  $ 1.00. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pulseras, cadenas, anillos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere que su negocio siga prosperando y terminar la escuela de chefs.
texts.en:
Edison O. is 24 years old. He lives in an urban area in the suburb of Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and has all of the basic amenities. He is a driver for a store from Monday through Friday. Due to the lack of opportunities and the desperate wish to have his own buisiness, Edison bought $ 10.00 worth of bracelets and handicrafts. This generated some income for him and he decided that this what going to be the business he had been hoping for so much. At present, he is still a driver but he works on weekends and holidays selling bracelets and handicrafts. This way, he has additional income for his personal expenses. He sells bracelets for $.05, necklaces for $ 1.00, and rings for $ 1.00. With the loan he wants to buy bracelets, necklaces, and rings for his business. In the future, he wants his business to continue to prosper and to finish studying to be a chef.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bracelets, necklaces, rings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plastics and drinks to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Juliana es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Juliana viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende ropa y de las ferias compra cereales, animales menores, productos que vende a sus vecinos.
Juliana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, blusas.
Juliana sueña con aumentar su mercadería y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Triunfo Community Bank. Juliana is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She travels to the markets in the area, where she sells clothes and buys grain, small animals, and products that she sells to her neighbors. Juliana needs a loan of 1,500 soles that she will invest in the purchase of sweaters and blouses. Juliana hopes to increase her merchandise and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweaters and blouses

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus, a 29-year-old married man, operates "The Top Designer’s" metal fabrication workshop where he manufactures collage seats, tables and office furniture.  He uses his income to pay wages to his employees, support his family and save money with Mwanzo Umoja group in Faulu Kenya.  Through the group, Justus has received two loans, repaying consistently.  He is now requesting a loan of Kes. 60,000 to buy metal tubes, resins and a new drilling machine.  He hopes to expand his business and open many outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy metal tubes, resins and a drilling machine

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 59 years old. Victoria is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Victoria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon. In 2006, he started working on his own in the agriculture business after four years of experience in the field.

He is now requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase equipment for the business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn P. is 55 years old and the village bank president. She was selected by the eight members who are located in Kanlaeng Khla village in Takeo province. Each member will use this loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Thorn P. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Neang, is a basket maker who earns a small income to support their family. In order to increase their income, Mrs. Thorn P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to breed. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. This couple has a child who is a student in a local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Eoun

texts.en:
Eoun O., 42, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products.

O. is a fisher and sells her fish for an income of USD 5.30 per day. Two of her children are employed at a local garment factory for an income of USD 120 each per month to help cover the family expenses. O. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to repair the house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to open a hair dressing shop for her daughter. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house.

loans.name: Loep

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 36, is married to Res Minh, age 41, and they have two school-aged kids.

S. combines various types of root trees to create natural medicine to examine people who are her nearby neighbors. This skill she learned from her grandparent, who died of senility years ago. As another source of family income, she has a life partner in her husband, who buys and sells vehicle,. He always buys secondhand motorcycles at cheap prices, and then repairs/paints them for a while before selling them to raise revenue. Because the vehicle selling business is an important source of family income and in order to earn additional income, S. has decided to borrow a loan for her husband to buy more vehicles to resell.

loans.use: To buy more vehicles to resell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 40 years old, a widowed mother of three children who are now aged between 25 and 14. One of her children attends school.  She has been practising mixed farming for the last 20 years in the town of Kisii, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, tea leaves, milk, beans, sweet potatoes, millet, and bananas which she sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. She also operates a kiosk in the same area.

Anna has requested her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to lease more land for farming. The proceeds from this loan will enable her to educate her children and improve her living standards. 

In five years' time, she plans to venture into new markets and sell more products to outside markets. Her biggest challenges are pests and diseases that affect her crops. Bad debtors also affect her business and lack of capital for expansion. 

She appreciates the help and hopes for the partnership to continue into the future.

loans.use: To lease more land for farming

loans.name: Ferival

texts.en:
Ferival C. is from the village of Villaluz. He is 24 years old. Ferival is married. To make a living, Ferival owns & operates a business venture a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport to local members in the community. Ferival has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ferival joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ferival is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to maintain a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ferival from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to maintain a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida M. is a citizen of Tashkomur city, Kyrgyzstan. She is 32 and is married. Her family is rather big: together with her husband she is bringing up three children. The eldest daughter and her son are school pupils; the youngest one is a toddler. 

These business-like parents make their living by having their own workshop “Araket” for sand block manufacturing. All this started because Farida’s husband became interested in sand block production and then concluded that this business would be profitable. For two years now, this business has been the main source of family income. From the profits, they have managed to purchase equipment for sand block manufacturing (200000 soms) and also to obtain a flat (100000 soms). They earn on average 28,000 soms per month.

The family is planning to purchase a used car. They already have some money, but need some extra funds to achieve their aim. Hence they need a loan. In the future the couple want to expand their business and to begin producing glazed tiles.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a used car

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella M. has been selling cereals in Naivasha town for the last three years. She is 40 years old and is married to Timothy Muvengei. They have three children. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend, and this will be her second loan. She paid her first loan well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy peas, maize and beans in bulk to have enough stock to sell to her customers. In the future, Stella hopes to supply cereals to the hospitals, schools and hotels around Naivasha town.

loans.use: To add to her stock of peas, maize and beans for sale

loans.name: Marizel

texts.es: La Sra. Marizel M. es originaria de la comarca San Nicolás del municipio de Achuapa, se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 20 años. Tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado tres créditos para la compra de ganado y gracias a ello ha ido aumentando su hato ganadero. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de cuatro vacas con el objetivo de seguir aumentando su hato.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marizel M. is originally from the San Nicolás area in the municipality of Achuapa. She has been working with livestock for the last 20 years. 

She has worked with Ceprodel for the last 3 years and has received 3 loans which have helped her to buy livestock. Thanks to the loans she has been able to grow her flock. She is requesting this loan in order to buy 4 cows and continue increasing her flock.

loans.use: To buy 4 cows

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena B. is from the village of Looc Proper, Plaridel, in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, is single, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase more fish to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and have working capital

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy A. is a widow who lives in Sitio Ubay, Brgy. 1, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living selling fish and raising hogs. Judy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Judy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy piglets to raise so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Judy A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital to buy fish to sell and piglets to raise

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 39 años de edad, reside en Ereguayquin, departamento de Usulután, posee una tienda y venta de ropa, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 8, 7, 3 y 2 años de edad, quienes dependen económicamente de él,  este negocio surgió por idea de su esposa quien siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, no tiene horario de trabajo y actualmente necesita capital para incrementar el negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar esta inversión.
Dicha inversión ayudara a ampliar el negocio y será oportuno para crecer económicamente por medio de sus ganancias siendo este su principal objetivo dentro del comercio, así también ganar más clientela y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Luis is 39 years old.  He lives in Ereguayquin, in Usulután department.  He owns a store where he sells clothes.  He lives with his wife and four children aged 8, 7, 3 and 2 who are financially dependent on him.  The business was his wife's idea as she has always been in the business.  Luis doesn't have fixed working hours and currently needs working capital to increase his business.  He is requesting a loan to make this investment which will help him to expand his business and help him to grow financially through his profits, this being his main aim in his business.  He will also attract more customers and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Cesar Kleovanny

texts.es:
Cesar de 36 años, es guardia de seguridad en una empresa llamada “Proadma” ya tiene 1 año trabajando en la empresa con turnos rotativos. No ha tenido otra oportunidad de trabajo por eso ha tenido que trabajar en una actividad poco lucrativa. 

Viviendo con su esposo y cuatro hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 4 años en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento había muchas flores orquídeas) ha podido trabajar en horarios rotativos desde la mañana hasta la noche. 

El ha trabajado muy eficientemente para tener todas las necesidades que requiere su familia pero como no tiene muchos ingresos no ha podido construir bien su casa por eso el quiere con el préstamo comprar cemento, bloques, arena para su casa. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio y darle una buen vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 36 years old.  He is a security guard for a company called 'Proadma'.  He has been working for the company for one year on rotating shifts.  As he didn't have any other work opportunities, he has had to work in a job that doesn't pay very well.

Cesar lives with his wife and four children aged 10, 8, 6 and 4, in an urban area in Las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area called 'Las Orquídeas' – Orchids because when the place was discovered there were many orchids there).  He has been able to work rotating shifts from morning until night.

Cesar has worked very efficiently to cover all of his family's needs but as he doesn't have much income he hasn't been able to build his home very well.  For this reason, he would like to use his loan to buy cement, blocks and sand for his home.  In the future, he would like to have his own business and provide his family with a good life.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and stone

loans.name: Ada Zila

texts.es: Ada Zila se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene mucho tiempo de obtener este medio de vida que para ella es muy importante para proporcionarle a su familia el alimento diario. Hace más de 16 años que tiene experiencia en este negocio, es una persona que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Sus dos hijos que están a su cargo siempre buscan la forma de obtener buenas notas agradeciendo el sacrificio que su madre realiza. El crédito es para la compra de pantalones, calzado, ropa interior entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Ada Zila sells general merchandise. She spends a lot of time doing this, since for her it is very important to offer her family their daily bread. She has had this business for over 16 years. She is a person who is always looking for a way to improve her income. Her two children who are under her care are always trying to get good grades as they are grateful for the sacrifice that their mother makes for them. This loan is for the purchase of pants, shoes and underwear, among other items.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La señora Maribel
texts.en: Mrs Maribel

loans.use: to build a room on the front of the house

loans.name: Chimed

texts.en:
Chimed, 37, is married and lives with his wife and three sons in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a rented house. They used to live in a small village and came to the province center four years ago. Two of his sons attend local primary school. 

He started his clothing business in 2007. Now he sells different types of clothing at an outdoor stall at a local market. His sister helps him to purchase clothing from Erlian, the closest border city of China. As he has gained enough experience in the clothing business, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks to purchase more clothing for his business. His wife says, "We want to expand our business and buy a house where we can have a comfortable life with our children."

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: Luis Carlos tiene 23 años.es una persona muy responsable pues ha sido un buen cliente. La actividad económica de Luis es la venta de pollo. El dio inicio hace más de 3 años, pues era su único medio de ingreso ya que tenía que proporcionarle el pan de cada día. Y Logro salir adelante, Luis es un hombre muy luchador y que le gusta el trabajo duro. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pechuga, piernas, muslos entre otras partes del pollo. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
23-year old Luis Carlos is a very responsible person who has been a good client [of our institution]. He makes his living by selling chickens. He started this work more than three years ago--it was his only income and he had to do something to support himself each day. He managed to make a success of his venture; Luis is a fighter and he likes to work hard.

The loan he is now seeking is to buy chicken breasts, legs, and thighs etc. His dream is to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy more chicken pieces

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Age:                            38
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      5 (ages 10-20)
Business:                    Planting and harvesting taro for sale
Loan purpose:              To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome
Weekly profit:              450 Samoan talas (WST)

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                             1.5 out of 3
Level of Total Household Income:        1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.65 out of 3

Maria owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.  Maria needs a loan of 1750 WST to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST per week) to improve and/or expand the business.

In 2008, Maria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Maria's 4th loan with SPBD. 

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self esteem.  Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive updates on SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale up to 3--the higher the number, the better off the person.  The metrics are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites E. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Marites is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling children's products, such as toys & games.   Marites has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional children's toys. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional children's toys

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Aside from having an entrepreneurial spirit, Rosalie C., 35, has a strong mother intuition. Rosalie was not able to finish her courses in college, but her involvement in CCT* enabled her to build her own small business. She is now married to a driver named Arnel, and together they have four dependents. One is in high school, two are in elementary, and one is not yet studying. Together they live in Libertad, Pasay City.

Rosalie buys and sells accessories for a living. She has a space in the commercial area of their community in Libertad. There she displays her personally chosen accessories, which she hopes are fashionable enough to catch the attention of potential buyers. Rosalie has been selling accessories for fifteen years now, and she does it without the help of an employee. Monthly she and her husband are able to earn about $295.

To help her grow her business, Rosalie is borrowing an amount of 21,000 PHP to be able to purchase stylish accessories for sale. She acknowledges that the loan will help her in revolving the finances of her business. With this loan, she is able to buy huge quantities of stock and meet her family's daily needs as well.

One challenge Rosalie faces is the number of customer debts. Also, sometimes the daily sales are low. Another challenge is that her eldest child is beginning to keep bad company in school. She thus prays that she would have the time to focus on the studies of her children and keep them from bad influences. It is her earnest desire to bring them closer to the Lord. She also would like to have her own commercial space.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase stylish accessories for sale

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. 

For the past two years, she has been selling second-hand clothes wholesale and retail, at the market and from door to door. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season the demand for clothes is higher while during the months of January to July the demand is lower. Caroline dreams of establishing a clothes-selling stall in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase five bales of used clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her business.

loans.use: To purchase five bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba M. is a soft drinks seller from Eguafo Village, near the fishing town of Elmina. Having run this business for seven years, she wants to expand it further by purchasing more drinks, both in quantity and variety. She hopes that this will help her attract more customers and also meet the needs of her existing ones. Focused on long term growth, Aba plans to reinvest the additional earnings back into her business. 

Aba is married to a farmer and her income helps pay for many household expenses. Ultimately, she wants to save up enough to purchase a piece of land to build a home.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 40 years old and is married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Adela has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells fish, cooking oil and sugar. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom goes to school. Mary has taken a loan to stock more fish, cooking oil and sugar for resale. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more fish, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Emerita De Los Santos

texts.es: Emérita De Los Santos se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 2 que tiene este medio de vida. Ella siempre esta ofreciéndoles a sus clientes un buen servicio a sus clientes, Emérita tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, a los que tiene que mantener diariamente. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, la mayoría de sus vecinos son sus clientes que siempre están solicitándole diferentes productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes.
texts.en:
Emérita De Los Santos has managed a store for more than two years in order to earn a living. She always offers her customers good service.

Emérita has four dependent children who she must support on a daily basis. Her business is located in her home. Most of her neighbors are customers who are always requesting different products.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del comité fue la señora Marta quién  invito, motivó y organizo a sus amigas del barrio para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras ya que ha oído hablar muy bien de ese programa.
La sra. Marta se dedica a la costura ya desde hace varios años. Ella manifiesta ser una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, su único interés esta en darle todo lo que necesitan a sus hijos para que tengan un futuro mejor. Tienen cinco hijos estudiantes dos en la primaria, dos en la segundaria  y uno en la universidad. Ellos son su mayor esperanza.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de elementos de costura, para que pueda seguir con su trabajo. Ella sueña con abrir  su propio taller de costura en su casa. Trabaja duro para ir comprando maquinas y de esa manera también brindar lo mejor a sus hijos como ser educación, mejor comodidad en el hogar, ect.
texts.en:
Marta was the initial contact for the group’s formation.  She invited, motivated and organized her friends in the neighborhood to be part of the Enterprising Women Committee’s Program since she’d heard good things about the program.

Marta has been a seamstress for many years.  She states that she’s a very hard working, tenacious person.  Her only concern is providing her children with everything they need to have a better future.  They have five children.  Two are in elementary school, two are in secondary school and one is in university.  They are her greatest hope.

She asks for the loan to buy sewing supplies so that she can continue working.  She dreams with opening her own home based sewing shop.  She works hard to gradually purchase sewing machines in order to provide her children with the best like education, more comfort at home, etc.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and sewing machines.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del banco comunal La Positiva del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  Todavía tiene una hija que está a su cargo, su esposo es empleado en una institución del estado.
Los préstamos recibidos de Manuela Ramos le han servido para invertirlos en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cerveza.
Con su nuevo préstamo de s/.1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 cajas de cerveza, 3 paquetes de gaseosas guaraná, 2 paquetes de gaseosa pepsi, 3 paquetes de agua, 2 paquetes de inca cola, 2 paquetes de coca cola.
Su negocio está bien surtido  ahora ya puede  atender mejor a sus clientes  porque tiene variedad de productos.  Su esposo la ayuda los fines de semanas.
Manuela Ramos tiene mucha confianza en que las mujeres pueden conseguir lo que se proponen en la vida gracias a su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga is a member of “The Positive” Community Bank located in the Calleria Department in Ucayali. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. She has one child who is still a dependent. Her husband has a job with a state agency.
The loans that she has received from Manuela Ramos have allowed her to invest in her business. She sells drinks, sodas and beer.
With this new loan of 1800.00 new soles she will buy 15 cases of beer, 3 flats of guarana soda, 2 flats of water, 2 flats of Inca cola and 2 flats of coca cola. 
Her business now has a good variety of products. Her husband helps her on the weekends.
Manuela Ramos has a lot of confidence that the women are able to complete their obligations in life thanks to your efforts.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is an honest and hardworking woman. She is married and is the mother of four children. Her husband is working in the Russian Federation. She sells food in her grocery store. Her store is located near her house and she has many customers. She purchases merchandise from the local market of “Sadbarg” 3-4 times a week. Gulchehra would like a loan of 12,500 TJS to purchase new products for her store to increase her product range and expand this business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy food for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 55 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice and meat vending. Erlinda aspires to save enough to buy more farm land and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Nedia

texts.en:
Nedia is 25 years old and married with eight children. Three of her children are in school. She has a business selling tea in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Nedia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase items like a kettle and glasses needed to sell tea. She will use the extra income for paying school fees.

loans.use: to purchase items for selling tea.

loans.name: Sikona

texts.en:
Sikona has been practicing farming in Narok for the last seven years. He is 47 years old, married, and supports ten people.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He has repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He will be loaned KES.30,000. He plans to use this loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en: Haitham is a 22-year-old single man living with one parent and two siblings. He has been working as a painter since 2005. He works with multiple projects and has two part-time employees helping him with the work. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase scaffolding and renew his business tools. He reports that these purchases will enable him to provide his services to more customers and take on more projects.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and renew his business tools

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es: Karina es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Emprendedores de Casa Huerta” grupo que está conformado por 07 socios  entre hombres y mujeres entusiastas y honrados. Karina tiene 25 años de edad  es soltera, y solo vive con su padre, la cual  ha sido su motivo para superarse en la vida. Ella se dedica al servicio domestico anteriormente cuidaba un anciano, es de esa manera como se ha desempeñado, con el fin de querer mejorar busco otro trabajo la cual le ofrecían mayores ingresos, es por ello que  hace 06 meses  se dedica al cuidado de 1 niña. Es así como  Karina a su corta edad ha tenido que trabajar arduamente para que pueda  salir adelante, actualmente sus ingresos cubren algunos gastos del hogar y también los ahorra ya que va a empezar a  estudiar costura. El deseo de Karina es de poner un taller de costura en su domicilio, la cual brindara trabajo a otras personas ya que necesitará mano de obra.
