Con el crédito solicitado lo va utilizar para sus gastos del hogar  comprando arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos, pues comprando al por mayor le sale económico. La Alcancía Comunal “Emprendedores de Casa Huerta” agradecen la ayudad brindada. Olga no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Communal Bank group “Emprendedores de Casa Huerta”, which is made up of seven members, who are enthusiastic and honorable men and women.

Karina is 25 years old.  She is single and lives with her father, who has been her motivation for succeeding in life.  She works in domestic services.  She used to work taking care of an elderly man, but had the goal of wanting to improve her life, and so looked for other work that would provide her with better income.  This is why six months ago, she started working looking after a little girl.  

Even at her young age, Karina has had to work hard to be able to move ahead in life.  Currently her income covers some of the household expenses, and she is also saving as she wants to begin to study tailoring.  Karina's dream is to be able to have a sewing workshop in her home, where she can provide work for other people who need employment.

With the requested loan, she will be able to cover her household expenses by buying rice, sugar, milk and noodles.  She will buy them at wholesale, since it is cheaper.

The “Emprendedores de Casa Huerta” Communal Bank is grateful for the help being offered.    

Note that Olga could not be present for the photo because of work.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles.

loans.name: Sibelle

texts.en: Sibelle is a 19-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two siblings. She has owned a shoe shop for the past year. She always presents the new trends and collections to her customers to satisfy their demands. She is thankful for her business income; it allows her to improve her family’s financial status. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Ameen s.a.l., a Kiva partner, to purchase more shoes to sell. In the future, she plans to expand her business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos que ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez o ensino superior e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Maputo devido aos estudos, é professora na EPC 4 de Outubro ha mais de 22 anos e tem um salario de 9.700.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos e conseguiu pagar sem nenhumas dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para a sua casa (areia, cimento, pedra, blocos, e outros), para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa. Os primeiros emprestimos tambem foram para a mesma actividade.
Pretende concluir a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Leonor was born in the District of Manjacaze, in the Province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique, is married and is the mother of 5 children who are still in School. She completed her university degree but didn't continue with her studies due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She left her hometown for Maputo to pursue her studies. She has been a teacher at 'EPC 4 de Outubro' for more than 22 years and has a monthly salary of 9,700.00 meticals (MZN) which she spends on household expenditures and saves in her bank account (BIM). 

She has had loans from other banks and has managed to pay these off without any difficulties. She came to know of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her sixth loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 25,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase materials for her house (sand, cement, stone, blocks and others) to continue with the build work on her house. Her first loans were also for this activity. 

Leonor intends to complete her house and purchase a vehicle to increase the comfort of her family and as such, she will be soliciting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase materials for her house (sand, cement, stone, blocks and others)

loans.name: Mujeres Honestas Y Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Actualmente el grupo está integrado por 18 integrantes, las cuales están trabajando muy a gusto del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, ya en su segundo ciclo.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Ramona, vive con su marido y sus hijos, ella trabaja en una cantina.  Comenta que tiene buenas ventas, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos. Desea seguir con su trabajo para que de esa forma pueda crecer y aumentar sus ingresos.
Ella solicita la ayuda para la compra de golosinas, como ser galletitas, chupetines, chicles, jugos, gaseosas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes.  Ella como también sus compañeras está muy satisfecha con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
texts.en:
The women from this communal bank are from the city of Caacupé.  The group is comprised of 18 members who are happy to work with the Women Entrepreneurs Program, and they are in their second cycle.

The president of the group is Mrs. Ramona who lives with her husband and children.  She runs a canteen with high volume sales and earns a good income.  She wishes to continue working to increase her income further.

She is requesting a loan to buy sweets such as cookies, lollipops, chewing gum, juices, sodas and other items to have in stock to meet customer demand.  She and her colleagues are very grateful for the economic support they receive through the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cookies, lollipops, chewing gum, juices, sodas and other items.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Teresa se dedica a una pulpería desde hace 14 años y es muy eficiente en su trabajo, solicito el crédito para la compra de granos básicos, leche, huevos, fideos, fósforos, golosinas, refrescos, jugos y pan. Inicia esta actividad desde las 7 de la mañana que sus vecinos llegan a solicitar la variedad de productos que ofrece. Ella dice estar eternamente agradecida por la atención prestada y por darle la oportunidad de progresar económicamente y tener un mejor presente y futuro.
texts.en: Señora Teresa has had a grocery stoere for the last 14 years and is very efficient at her work. She is asking for the loan to buy dry grains, milk, eggs, noodles, matches, sweets, soft drinks, juices and bread. She starts her work from 7 every morning which is when her neighbours come to buy from the variety of good she offers. She says that she is eternally grateful for the interest shown her and for being given the opportunity to progress economically and have a better present and future.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, milk, eggs, matches, sweets, soft drinks, juices and bread.

loans.name: Mujeres Dinámicas Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva el nombre de MUJERES DINAMICAS nombre elegido por las 10 mujeres que hacen parte de este comité de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya, quienes viven en la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, pero comentan que se encuentran con mucho entusiasmo para seguir con los demás ciclos.
Una de las miembros es la señora Gloria, quien trabaja en la cría de gallinas, comenta que es un trabajo muy lindo y que le encanta. Gracias a esto ella puede salir adelante en sus proyectos, pues esto le genera los ingresos necesarios. Le gustaría seguir creciendo y algún día tener un local donde vender sus pollos.
Ella solicita el crédito para que por medio de este pueda seguir creciendo, pues quiere comprar más gallinas para la cría y luego venderlas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le da, pues es muy importante para ella y las otras miembros.
texts.en:
The name of the Mujeres Dinámicas group was chosen by the ten women who make up this Fundación Paraguaya communal bank of women, who live in the city of Villa Ygatimi.  They are currently in the first loan cycle of the Fundación's program for women entrepreneurs, but they say they're very enthusiastic about continuing with the other cycles.

One of the members is Gloria, who works raising chickens.  She says it's a wonderful job and she loves it.  Thanks to this she can get ahead in her projects, since this generates the necessary income for her.  She would like to continue growing and one day have a place to sell her chickens.

She is requesting the loan so that she can continue to grow, since she wants to buy more chickens to raise and later sell.  She is grateful for this opportunity that is being given to her, since it's very important for her and the other members.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario, is a 43-year-old entrepreneur and is married to Bernadeta, a 29-year-old lady. They are blessed with three children, namely: Thomas, 11, studying at the 1st grade of Elementary School; Melanie, 5, studying in kindergarten; and Stevania 3. Mario and wife originate from East Timor. They moved to West Timor in 1999.

To support his family, Mario is running a poultry business. He has been engaged in this business for three years. He initiated the business by raising 100 chicks. Since the business is growing well, Mario was able to raise more than 200 chicks in the coop. He recently sold the chickens after raising them for a month.

However Mario is thinking to add more chicks to be raised. He is sure that his chickens will be sold quickly, particularly on Christmas Day. For that reason, he is seeking the loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. He would like to purchase more chicks and feed for them. He also wants to enlarge the coop so it will be able to accommodate the additional chicks. Mario believes that the business income will enable him to support his children's education costs and to renovate his house as well.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is engaged in agriculture. Unable to insure enough income by selling fruits from her orchard, Gohar would like to sell more fruits. She has applied for a loan to purchase more fruits, keep them in the freezer and sell them during winter. This will allow Gohar to save money and use it next year to develop her orchard making it more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for fruits

location.town: Nor Dvin village of Ararat region

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 
Ma. Victoria is providing videoke or karaoke services where customers pay 5 pesos per song. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools &to pay for the electricity for the services.
Ma. Victoria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ma.Victoria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for the electricity for the services

loans.name: Angel Gerardo

texts.es: El señor Angel tiene 26 años, es soltero, no tiene conviviente y tampoco hijos ni dependientes, termino el colegio y estaba estudiando en la universidad, iba en el tercer año pero no logro terminarlo por falta de recursos económicos, vivió con sus padres, los cuales decidieron quitarle la ayuda económica para que su hijo fuese mas independiente. Actualmente alquilo una pieza junto a su hermana en la zona de Amancayas. El solicitante trabaja en el servicio de transporte urbano, tiene 3 años de experiencia, trabaja de lunes a sábado, su principal gasto es el pago diario al dueño del vehículo por alquileres. El propietario y nuestro cliente se pusieron de acuerdo en asumir los gastos de reparación y mantenimiento del vehículo a 50% cada uno. Para tener mayores ingresos nuestro cliente hace un mes inauguro un ballet de bailes típicos del oriente. El crédito solicitado en la institución es para pagar la instalacion del salon de baile.
texts.en:
Angel, 26, is single; he has no spouse or dependent children.  He completed high school and was attending university.  He was in third year but was unable to finish due to lack of economic resources.  He lived with his parents who decided to stop supporting him so that he would become more independent.

At present, he and his sister have rented a room together in the Amancayas neighborhood.  He works providing urban transportation services; he has three years’  experience.  He works Monday to Saturday and his main expense is the daily vehicle rental fee he pays the vehicle’s owner.  The vehicle’s owner and our client agreed to share vehicle repair and maintenance costs 50% each.

To earn more income, a month ago our client started a traditional eastern dances ballet company.  He’s asking the institution for a loan to pay to set up a dance studio.

loans.use: to set up a dance studio.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PARA TRATAMIENTO OFTALMICO

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Vingunguti area of Ilala district in Dar es Salaam.She is married and has four children.Three of them are in primary school ,one in secondary school.With the help of her husband and a loan from Governments Women Fund she managed to build a hall near her family house.Her hall named ‘Connection’ is one of the best halls in her area.The hall is usually overbooked over the weekends for different functions like wedding ceremonies,send-offs,meetings,baptism and the like.What drives her back is the lack of a pool table and insufficient chairs.A pool table acts as an entertainment for people who came to take drinks after working hours.Almost all nearby halls have pool tables.A competitive disadvantage for her.Few chairs in the hall also acts as a drawback to her business.She has to overcome these drawbacks before her competitors grab her market share. She is in need of USD 750 to facilitate her plan.

loans.use: PURCHASE POOL TABLE AND CHAIRS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane Njeri Njuguna intends to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clémentine is 45 years old and a mother of six children. She has been active in her business since 1986. She began her business with $30 selling fresh fish. She sells clothing and miscellaneous goods. She joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo microfinance program) in 2004 and has received seven loans. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Clémentine’s business has prospered, and her current business capital is $800. With a loan of $500, Clémentine wants to buy 2 bundles of clothing and increase the inventory of miscellaneous goods.

loans.use: To purchase 2 bundles of clothing and increase the inventory of miscellaneous goods  in bulk for resale

loans.name: Mirzaga

texts.en: Mirzaga lives in the Salyan region,  Yenikand village. He is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children. Mirzaga has his own vineyard, where he grows vines. He has 15 years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan $725 to buy orchard medicines. He wants to improve his vine growing and get more income.

loans.use: To buy orchard medicines

loans.name: Jose Jorge

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Jose and I sell ice cream for a living. This product is in high demand due to the hot climate in Honduras. My business is mobile; I visit various suburbs of Tegucigalpa to maximize my sales. My wife and children help out by selling ice cream from our home, as there is a school nearby and students buy our ice cream after class.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola me llamo Jose y me dedico a la venta de helados, este productos es comprado en grandes cantidades ya que el clima en Honduras es caliente. Mi negocio es ambulante, visito varias colonias de Tegucigalpa para poder obtener mejores ventas. Mis hijos y esposa ayudan a vender en mi casa, ya que cerca hay una escuela y los niños compran despues de salir de sus clases.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of ice cream products

loans.name: Biyang Ayu

texts.id:
Gusti Ayu Biang S. is a widow whose husband died long ago. In her not too young age, Biang S. has to rely on her pig farm to earn a living. Previously, Biang S. raised piglets sold to butchers or restaurants. Since joining DINARI foundation, Biang S. started to develop her farm bu purchasing a breeding pig. Due to her old age, her Biyang Ayu's two daughters that live next door are helping her too. They feed the pgs twice a day, once in the morning and once in the afternoon. Every 6 months a breeder can give birth to 8 piglets. Cost for feed and medication is about $80, and she can earn about $220, so she can earn $150 per 6 months. The profit from the farm is used to pay for Biyang Ayu and her daughters' daily living expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Gusti Ayu Biang S. adalah seorang janda, karena suaminya sudah lama meninggal. Di usianya yang sudah tidak muda lagi, untuk mencukupi keperluan hidupnya Biang S. hanya mengandalkan usaha ternak babi. Sebelumnya Biang S. memelihara bibit babi dan dijual untuk babi guling. Semejak bergabung dan mendapat bantuan dana dari Yayasan DINARI, Biang S. mulai mengembangkan dengan memembeli satu ekor induk. Karena kondisi Biang S. sudah cukup lanjut maka pemeliharaan dibantu keduan anak perempuannya yang tinggal disebelah rumahnya. Pemberian pakan dilakukan dalam sehari hanya 2 kali yaitu pagi dan sore hari. Dalam 6 bulan Induk babi melahirkan 8 ekor bibit babi. Pengeluaran pemeliharaan untuk pakan dan pengobatan menghabiskan dana Rp. 700.000,-. Total keseluruhan penjualan 8 ekor secara sistem gulingan Rp. 2.000.000,- . Total keuntungan bersih selama 6 bulan mencapai Rp.1.300.000,-. Dengan keuntungan dari usahanya dipakai untuk mencukupi keperluan sehari-hari dan memberikan upah kepada kedua anaknya perempuannya yang sudah membantu memelihara babinya untuk dapat dipakai mencukupi kebutuhan sehari-harinya.

loans.use: Purchase Breeding Pig

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina is 27 years old and is the mother of a child aged 10. She has a small shop where she sells snacks and groceries. She can earn about US$ 5 per day. Her husband, M., sells ice at the market and usually earns about US$ 3.50 per day. Nina is requesting a US$ 75 loan to expand her store's inventory. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her little store with more inventory

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim P. (age 27) and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Sim and her husband (age 30), married for seven years, have one son. Their son is still young and stays at home. Sim is requesting her third loan with Maxima for the amount of $200, to buy thread and silk material for weaving.  Sim has been weaving (a skill she learned from her mother) for many years.  Her husband is also a silk weaver. He learned the skill from his wife and has been weaving for five years.

loans.use: To purchase thread and and silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a compressor for her workshop

loans.name: Tiba's Raia Mwema Group

texts.en:
Tiba is a married woman with 3 children, ages 18, 15 ,and 12 years old. Tiba owns a small food store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Benadeta, who has a little cafe.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is an excellent teacher of traditional dance and a loving mother; with the help of her husband she works not only to share her knowledge of dance with young students of the city, but also in selling a variety of household articles in various markets. These jobs have helped her to ensure the well-being of her children, but in her heart is the hope of creating a small school of traditional dance to pass on the artistic legacy of her ancestors to the youth of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

Consuelo es una excelente maestra de danzas típicas y un amorosa madre; con ayuda de su querido esposo se dedica además de impartir sus conocimientos a los jóvenes estudiantes de su ciudad a ofertar los días de feria diversos artículos de uso doméstico en los diferentes lugares de concentración popular.Estas actividades le han otorgado bienestar a sus queridas pequeñas, pero acogen en sus corazones el deseo de instalar en casa una pequeña escuela de danzas típicas para interiorización del legado artístico de sus antepasados a las generaciones jóvenes de su ciudad.

loans.use: Capital to install a school of traditional dance in her home.

loans.name: Mohammad Nadar

texts.en: Mohammad Nadar lives in district 8 of Kabul Afghanistan. He is not formally educated, but he has been involved in the bakery business for more than 9 years. He learned this business from his father. He is requesting a loan so he can open another bakery that will be his own business.

loans.use: To start a new bakery business

loans.name: Fanny Eva

texts.es:
Fanny C. is 28 years old and lives in the zone of Tembladerani in La Paz. She is single, has one daughter, and is financially independent in that she doesn't need to take money from her parents. Fanny works in the office of an architecture firm in the city.

The loan will be used to buy materials so that she can prepare plans and property registration procedures herself and avoid delays.

The social and economic analysis shows that she is a good candidate for this loan and will be able to repay the it.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Fanny Chávez (28 años) vive en la zona de Tembladerani (La Paz), es soltera y económicamente independiente (no cuenta con ayuda de sus padres y tiene una hija). Fanny trabaja en una oficina de Arquitectura de nuestra ciudad.

El crédito destinado para comprar material y así poder elaborar planos y trámites catastrales, lo que permitirá que desarrolle su trabajo sin las presentes demoras

El análisis social y económico realizado en esta clienta demuestra que esta en aptas condiciones para hacer los pagos del crédito.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS NEEDED TO PREPARE PROPERTY REGISTRATION DOCUMENTS

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana M. sells sandals, second-hand clothing, and onions. She is single and her income does not provide enough support for Diana and her five children. Her goods are in high demand, so she is asking for additional capital to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 30 years old. She is married and she has 6 children. She became a food seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 5 AM to 8 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Salma now hopes for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok L. is 49 years old and works as rice farmer. She lives with four of her five children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1979, she and her husband have been working on their rice field to earn a living and are able to make less than $1 each day. They told a loan officer that farmers are making less profit and need to worry about the weather conditions because most of them have no irrigation systems yet. People need to farm by depending on the sky and if there is no rain they risk damage to their rice crop. The couple are also aided by their children who contribute $50 a month to support the family. To double the family income, Mrs. Sok is asking a loan to raise ducks for eggs.

loans.use: To raise ducks for eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of clothing

loans.name: Shaheed

texts.en:
Shaheed is 38 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a small village near the Southern Lebanese city of Nabatieh. 

Shaheed owns a tractor and is contracted to till the land of local farmers who cannot afford a tractor of their own. Currently, his tractor suffers from many mechanical problems. In order to repair it, he needs additional money. Thus, he has requested a loan of 900 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to repair it.

loans.use: To perform repairs on his tractor

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: Daouda tient une quincaillerie au quartier de Santhiaba. Ce jeune entrepreneur marié et pére de 02 enfants arrive grâce à son commerce de subvenir aux besoins familiaux; Il sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son stock et réaliser davantage de profit.
texts.en:
Daouda has a hardware store in the Santhiaba section of town. Thanks to that business, this young entrepreneur, who is married and the father of two children, is able to meet the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan to increase his inventory in order to earn more profit.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of spare parts

loans.name: San Miguel De Mayocc Group

texts.en:
Members of the San Miguel D. Mayocc Village Bank live and meet in the community of Mayocc, in Churcampa Province of Huancavelica Department, in central Peru. The town sits on the left bank of the Mantaro River at about 2,300 meters above sea level. The weather in the area is very warm.

Most of the community is involved in commerce or fruit production; the fruit is sold mainly in Huanta. There is also some livestock in the area, including a number of guinea pig farms.

Alberta and Candelaria are two members of the San Miguel D. Mayocc Village Bank. Alberta is married with four children, who are 20, 16, 14 and 10 years old. She raises and sells guinea pigs, a business she has been involved in for the past three years. At first, the business was difficult, since her guinea pigs had fleas, but now the problem is under control, thanks in part to loans from FINCA, which she used to buy medicine. She plans to use her current loan of 200 soles to fix the irrigation system for her alfalfa, which she grows to feed the guinea pigs. Her dreams for the future are for her children to graduate with professional degrees, and to have a large guinea pig farm.

Candelaria is married with five children, who are 25, 23, 20, 18 and 16 years old. She also has a guinea pig farm; she buys young animals and fattens them up to resell. Like Alberta, Candelaria had problems when she first started raising guinea pigs because they got sick and died and she didn’t know how to keep them healthy. She has learned a lot about the animals since then, and they don’t get sick any mO.. She plans to use her loan of 500 soles to buy supplements for her guinea pigs, so that she can fatten them up and sell them in the city of Ayacucho. Like Alberta, Candelaria’s dreams for the future are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to have a large guinea pig farm.

loans.use: Fix irrigation system on farm, buy nutritional supplements for guinea pigs, etc.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sariani

texts.id:
Periode ini Ni Wayan Sariani kembali melanjutkan pinjaman dari yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipegunakan untuk menambah modal dalam berusaha sebagai Pembuat Sanggah ( Sarana persembahyangan Umat Hindu ). Pesanan Sanggah dalam setiap bulannya tidak pernah terhenti bahkan kadang sampai menolak pesanan karena bahan baku kayu jati sulit dicari. Untuk memenuhi persediaan maka jauh hari harus membeli kayu ke penjual kayu jati karena kayu jati adalah kayu yang paling baik untuk bahan bakunya. Proses pengerjaan Sangahnya dipercayakan pada suaminya,sedang pekerjaan yang ringan ringan dikerjakan oleh Ni Wayan Sariani.

Satu paket pesanan sanggah harga bervariasi sekitar Rp.2.000.000,- s/d Rp.3.000.000,- sesuai permintaan dan tingkat kesulitan membuat ukirannya.Dalam satu bulan Ni Wayan Sariani dan suaminya dapat menyelesaikan satu sampai dua pesanan sanggah. Apabila pesanan banyak biasanya Ni wayan Sariani mempekerjakan  orang lain yang sudah biasa membantunya. Dari usaha tukang inilah Ni Wayan Sariani dapat membantu suaminya dalam mencukupi keperluan keluarganya bersama seorang anaknya yang masih sekolah dasar.
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Sariani wants to participate in another loan program with DINARI foundation. This loan is to be used to add her working capital in her business as Sanggah maker. Sanggah is a traditional religious article in Balinese Hinduism faith.

Her business always receives flow of orders of Sanggah every month. In some occasions she even has to reject orders as she cannot secure enough material to make Sanggah. Ni Wayan Sariani is in this business together with her husband who does most of the Sanggah making works.

One Sanggah can be sold for IDR 2 million to IDR 3 million (around USD 190 - USD 285) depending on the complexity of the wood carving works. In one month Ni Wayan and her husband can make one to two Sanggah. If she has more orders then she hires extra helps. From this business Ni Wayan can help the family's economy and they are also able to send their children to school.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood as material

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa M. sells food supplies and fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market to sell at the Amoabin market near Cape Coast. Adjoa has received a junior high education. She is divorced and has six dependants. Adjoa has been selling fish and food supplies for about two years now. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more food supplies and fish in larger quantities for processing and sales. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the expansion of her trade in processed fish.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies and fish in larger quantities for processing and sales

loans.name: Tièssiri  3 (Soyons Courageux) Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 5 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au premier quartier  de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente  de bois de chauffe  et la restauration. Elles sont très sollicitées dans ces activités. 
Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son cinquième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour  constituer un stock important de bois de chauffe, acheter  des sacs de haricot et des bidons d’huile alimentaires. Le bois de chauffe est vendu  en détail, au comptant à la maison. Quant au haricot il est vendu après cuisson, la nuit au carrefour avec de l’huile.
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 140 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en faisant le stockage de  céréales toutes qualités confondues et être grossiste dans la vente du bois de chauffe.
texts.en:
The six women of the Tiessiri group are all married, are on average 30 years old with 5 children, and live in large traditional extended families in the first district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know each other as neighbours and as relatives. They all engage in almost the same type of businesses: firewood sales and food preparation. They are highly sought after in this work. In the framework of improving the quality of their services and enlarging the size of their businesses, the members of the Confiance group decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are seeking their fifth solidarity (group) loan. All of their previous loans were repaid properly. They intend to use this loan to create a sizable stock of firewood and to buy bags of beans and cans of cooking oil. The firewood is sold at retail in cash at their homes. As for the beans, they are sold after cooking at night at the crossroads with the oil. They each hope to earn an average profit of 140,000 FCFA during this loan cycle, which will be used to repay the loan and meet the needs of their extended families, with the rest being invested in their businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their business by stocking cereals of all types together and becoming wholesalers of firewood.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, cooking oil, and beans

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. is currently in the business of petty trading and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Mary is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Mrs. Esteria A. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental and is 47 years old.  She is married with 7 children:   3 of them are married, 1 is working at Cebu City as an office clerk and the others are still in school.

Mrs. A.'s husband is a chief cook on a ship. Their life is not as complicated as other people's, in terms of finances. Mrs. A. decided that in addition to taking care of her children, she would start a hog-raising business. She took out a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in November 2007 to purchase piglets and feed. Mrs. A. and her husband hope to witness the success of their children as fruits of their endeavors.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed

loans.name: Eleazar Rafael

texts.es: El joven Eleazar Bermúdez, tiene 25 años de edad,  es sastre oficio que hace desde hace nueve años realiza, el cual aprendió con su mama con fondos propios, los clientes que llegan hacer costura dejan el cincuenta por ciento de adelanto y eso es una ayuda para poder terminar el trabajo. Reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es soltero, este es el segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de un rollo de tela, hilos y otros que ayuden a elaborar su trabajo. Sus planes  es poder comprar equipo de trabajo industrial para crecer en su negocio y poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Young Eleazar Bermúdez is 25 years old. He has been a tailor for the past 9 years, he learned from his mother and started the business with his own money. The customers who bring sewing to him leave 50% down and this helps him to be able to finish the work. He lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood and is single. This is his second loan with Afodenic, which he will use to buy a bolt of fabric, thread and other things that will help him work. His plans are to buy an industrial sewing machine so he can grow his business and be able to provide good service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Afisatu

texts.en:
Afisatu K., a 39-year-old divorced mother of three sons and two daughters, all currently in junior high and primary school, lives with them in a rented apartment in Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Afisatu is a food vendor who operates a ‘chop bar,’ a local restaurant near the market square in her community that sells a variety of local dishes. She procures bags of cassava, maize and other ingredients from nearby towns and prepares and sells the food at the bar from morning to evening. Afisatu has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure food items in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cassava, maize and other ingredients.

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Altansuh C. is married and the father of two daughters. His family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic housing, like a yurt) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His eldest daughter goes to an elementary school, and his youngest, who is 3 years old, stays at home.

With his spouse, Gereltuya, Altansuh has been running a shoe sales business since 2001. He goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, twice every month and to Beijing once a quarter, to purchase girls' shoes at wholesale prices. His spouse, Gereltuya, sells the shoes at her shoe stall, which is located at the Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. The market runs year round despite the extreme winter temperatures.

During the last three years, he has been building a house for himself and for his family. He is planning to complete the house in the coming autumn and move in. Altansuh hopes to have his own indoor stall to prevent his wife from getting sick from working outside during the freezing winter. With this loan, he will buy more shoes for his business and construction material to complete the house where his family will live.

loans.use: To buy shoes and construction material

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard B. owns a garage in Ibanda town, Bufunda Street. He works together with his brother and they train motorcycle mechanics. Before operating a garage, he was working in the tourism industry. He saved his money and started his own garage, "Mapema". He has been in the business for seven years so far and he has good customer care which has enabled him get many customers. This loan is to purchase more motorcycle spare parts for his garage. 
Richard is 39 years old and has been blessed with two children, ages 10 and 5 years old, both in school.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for a garage

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita R., from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, is a 44-year-old married mother of four adult-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a sari-sari or general store whose main source of income comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an embroidering machine and a sewing machine

loans.name: Chod

texts.en:
Chod S. is married and has two young children. He lives with his wife in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, he is involved in a business as phone repairman at a local market in the city, typically earning approximately US $5 per day. His wife stays at home takes care the children who are too young to attend the school.
 
The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of US $200 to purchase phone accessories and parts to expand his business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: purchasing phone accessories and parts

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 34 years old, and is married with two school-aged children. She is very hardworking in order to support her husband in providing food and shelter for their household. For the last two years Constance has owned and operated a grocery shop selling items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed milk powder and biscuits in her neighborhood. It has been her dream to expand her business by adding other foodstuffs to her existing range.

With her loan, Constance wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, and also expand into foodstuffs such as tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of foodstuffs for her grocery store

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
N. Zulfiya has 10 years of experience selling dried fruits. She is 43 years old and married. She uses all the money she makes to take care of her three children and provide for their education. Zulfiya always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today, Zulfiya requests 4000 somoni to purchase dried fruits for processing in order to increase the variety of her goods. Zulfiya expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Emilia  Custodio

texts.pt:
Emilia nasceu na cidade de maputo, distrito de boane, tem 38 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos com 13,06 e 03 anos de idade que freqüentam escola publica de boane na excepção do mais novo. Vive na casa própria com marido, filhos e sem ninguém mais por sustentar. Fez a 9 classe tendo parado devido à gravidez precoce.

Nunca saiu do distrito e cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores. Seu marido continua a estudar e também faz actividade comercial. Emilia tem 9 anos de experiência na venda de roupa usada e nova (cortinas, roupa uni sexo para todas as idades). Vende mais fatos para homens e senhoras que adquire na áfrica do sul a 740.00MT e 1.500,00MT e revende a 1.500,00MT e 2.000,00MT, respectivamente. Obtém um rendimento aprox. de 20.000,00MT proveniente das vendas.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos e teve informações sobre as actividades da Hluvuku-Adsema através da sua irmã, também cliente da instituição.
Este é o primeiro empréstimo da Emilia no valor de 25.000,00MT para compra e venda de roupa e nova para todas as idades, principalmente fatos para homens e senhoras.
Vai poder satisfazer a demanda e ganhar mais receitas. 

Vem construindo em fases uma casa de alvenaria, juntamente com o seu marido, para confortar a sua família. Sonha concluir a casa para posterior apetrecha mento e para tal propõe se a reembolsar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos.
texts.en:
Emilia is from Maputo, in the district of Boane, in Mozambique. She is 38, married and has three children aged 16, 6 and 3. The two older ones go to public school in Boane. She studied until 9th grade but had to drop school due to an unplanned pregnancy. She never left Boane. Her husband still goes to school and works in retail. Emilia has 9 years of experience in the clothing retailing business (new and used clothes for people of all ages). Her main profit comes from the suits she buys from South Africa and sells to the gentlemen in town. She makes around 20.000,00MT (U$700) per month selling clothes. This is Emilia's first loan and she is asking for U$900 to buy more inventory for her clothing business. She hopes to be able to fill up the demand and get more clients. Meanwhile, she's been builiding a house with the help of her husband, and she dreams of the day their home will be ready.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for reselling

loans.name: C8639 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
V. Nyirasafari is 27 years old, married without children but with one dependent whom they care for and who is 15 years old. Her husband works as well, and earns approximately 60,000 RFW per month (105 US dollars).  V. and her family live in Rubavu district, in the western province of Rwanda where her retail shop is located.  V. is a seasoned entrepreneur with 5 years of successful businesses, selling different kind of products in her  locally popular General Store.

V. is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to add to her working capital, purchase more inventory, provide more products to her existing customers, and hopefully attract new customers as well.  She projects that her monthly profit will increase significantly more than the current level of 80,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: More merchandise for her store

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Monsieur Salif Traoré est un homme marié de 35 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez lui même dans le  quartier Médine de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, dés à son âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus.
Avant de mener l’activité d’achat et de vente des appareils électroniques, il menait des activités de travaux journaliers.  C’est quelques années plus tard il décida de mener d’autres activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des appareils électroniques. Il a appris cette activité auprès d’un de ses  amis.  Avec une expérience de 5 ans, Monsieur Salif Traoré maîtrise son activité et est très apprécié à Bougouni.
Pour avoir un fonds de roulement indispensable à l’épanouissement de son entreprise, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des appareils électroniques (lampes, torches,radios...). Il est à son premier prêt individuel  avec l’institution. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale. Il participe régulièrement aux marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants de Bougouni.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Salif Traoré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 32 500 FCFA
Dans les années à venir il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Salif Traoré is a 35-year-old married man with two children. He lives with his wife and children, right in the Médine neighborhood in the town of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having gone to school, Mr. Traoré began his revenue-generating business activities at a young age. He used to work as a day laborer, but some years later he decided to start other income-generating business activities such as the buying and selling electrical appliances. He learned this trade from one of his friends. With five years’ experience, Mr. Traoré has mastered his craft and is highly thought of in Bougouni. To establish a contingency fund, essential for growing his business, he decided to work with Kiva Field Partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to purchase electrical appliances (e.g., lamps, torches, radios). This is his first individual loan with this institution. He stocks up in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali), and sells his wares retail to locals for cash or credit. He regularly participates in the weekly markets in the villages around Bougouni. With this loan, Mr. Traoré expects to make a monthly profit of 32,500 FCFA. In the coming years he hopes to extend his store.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M., from the village of Canta-an, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province, is 43 years old, married and the mother of three grown children. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing business whose income is derived from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: To make a living, Patience sells CDs and VCDs (video compact discs) at retail and wholesale prices to her customers. She is a highly-focused, hard-working woman. She is also friendly and uses her skills to attract more customers to her stall. She hopes to be a major distributor of VCDs in her community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 42 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is a commercial driver and also works hard to support his family. She has applied for a loan for 150,000 NGN to buy more CDs and VCDs to sell. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for helping make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and VCDs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en: Bernice is thirty years old. She is a widow with a child who is currently in school. Bernice is hard-working and this business is her main source of income. She sells ladies' shoes, slippers etc. through “hawking.’ Hawking is a means of selling where sellers carry the items on their head and move from house to house. She wants to use the loan to buy more ladies' shoes, slippers etc. to increase her stock to make more income and provide her child with a good education. She is expecting higher profit this season since most people buy new shoes for themselves and their families during Christmas.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and slippers in bulk

loans.name: Vita's Group

texts.en:
Vita C. is from the village of Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 33 years old. Vita is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vita C.'s group.

Vita is married and has  2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Vita has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Vita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Vita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling of cell phone accessories

loans.name: Wycliffe Onyango

texts.en:
Wycliffe Onyango O. is 26 years old and is from Migori town. He is married to Judith Auma and they have no children as they are newlyweds.

Wycliffe sells secondhand shoes in Migori market and is looking for funds to enable him to add stock to his business. He plans to buy more shoes, especially for the men, since there is a high demand for a particular design. His mainly sells to people within the market.

This is Wycliffe’s second loan from KADET after successfully repaying his first one. He hopes to diversify into selling secondhand clothes in the future.

loans.use: To add stock to his business by purchasing more shoes

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum V., age 43, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children.

She and her husband are construction workers, earning approximately an income of US$ 3.5 each per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 1998. Her standard of living has been improved since V. is with this job.

V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of KiV.. (V. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma B. is from the village of  Daan Lungsod, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old, married and has 1 infant. Wilma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food & daily-use products. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora L. tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad, que ya vive aparte. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como vestuario, productos de belleza y productos varios como cobertores, sabanas. Ella realiza sus compras solamente por encargos, es decir cuando ya tiene bastantes pedidos. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 11 años, esto fue debido a la falta de empleo, y actualmente este negocio constituye la mayor fuente de ingresos de su familia. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 para ser invertido en la compra de mercadería nueva, esto con el objetivo de aprovechar las ventas de verano que se acercan. Desea diversificar su inventario comprando trajes de baño, protector solar. Algo que la afecta durante algunos periodos del año, es que las ventas se disminuyen, por lo que ella aprovecha cuando vienen las épocas buenas para invertirle más a su negocio. El sueño consiste en continuar creciendo en su negocio y de esta manera ampliar las instalaciones en las cuales actualmente tiene localizado su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora L. is 57 years old, a single mother of 3 grown children that live on their own. She sells general merchandise such as clothing, beauty products and other products as comforters and sheets. She buys only when she has enough orders. She started in this business 11 years ago because she could not find a job, currently this is the major source of income for her family. She is requesting a loan at the Fundación León 2000 for the purchase of new merchandise and to be able to take advantage of the upcoming summer sales. She wants to vary her inventory by purchasing bathing suits and sun screens. At times during the year her sales taper off, so she takes advantage of the good selling seasons to invest in her business. Her dream is to continue growing her business and enlarge the space where her business is located.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es transportista inter-ciudad La Paz – El Alto; trabaja en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa, tiene su taxi que trabaja de trufi, es su principal fuente de trabajo con que cubre la manutención de su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. Vive en la casa de sus padres sin pagar alquiler en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la reparación de sus herramienta de trabajo (compra de llantas y amortiguadores)  de esa forma seguirá trabajando para poder cubrir los gastos familiares.
 
Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación de otro préstamo para Juan.
texts.en:
Juan is a taxi driver on the inter-city line between El Alto and La Paz. He works as a member of the Eduardo Avaroa labor union. He has a taxi that works as a minibus, and it is his principal source of employment. With his taxi earnings, he is able to support his wife and two small sons, ages 6 and 2. He lives rent-free in his parents house in July 16 zone of El Alto. The loan he requests will go towards the repair of his instrument of work, specifically to purchase new tires and shock absorbers. By replacing these parts, he will be able to continue covering his family's expenses through his taxi service earnings. This is Juan's second loan with IMPRO. His record of responsible behavior and proper repayment permits his approval for an additional loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de llantas y amortiguadores para su taxi.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene dos hijos  de las cuales ya son independientes. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender yogurt en el mercado de Vino Canchón del distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya es un año  que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella es una mujer  responsable y emprendedora que busca  a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella requiere el crédito para comprar azúcar y saborizantes. Janet se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Janet is a member of the community bank Mi Peru of the Arariwa association. She has two children who are independent. Janet's principal economic activity is selling yogurt at the Vino Canchon market in the district of San Jeronimo in the city of Cusco. She has been doing this for a year and she is doing very well. She is a responsible and enterprising woman who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead and with her daily efforts provide a better future for her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase sugar and flavorings. Janet is grateful for the opportunity afforded to her through this medium and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar and flavorings.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 35-year-old married man who has four children who go to school.  He has been doing metal fabrication for two years and has employed three people.  He makes and sells window frames, door frames and metallic chairs.  He belongs to Budea SHG group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other's loans.  Since he joined the group, he has managed to purchase a welding machine and open up a workshop.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy metal bars.  He hopes to open up another workshop in the future.

loans.use: To buy metal bars

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.fr: N. Euphrasie est née en 1985 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Euphrasie est mariée à HODONOU Julien, un chauffeur. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. La famille vit à PK10- Enafa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis une dizaine d’année. Euphrasie subvient avec son mari aux différents besoins de la famille. Euphrasie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Euphrasie mène comme activité la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (glacière, bols en séries, bassines, etc.) de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Euphrasie vend des savons. Euphrasie s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Euphrasie exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Euphrasie sollicite un deuxième prêt pour augmenter son stock de produits, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
N. Euphrasie was born in 1985 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé County. She is married to HODONOU Julien, a chauffeur.  The couple have three children, some of whom are in school.  The family has been living for about ten years in PK10-Enafa, in the community of Sèmè-Podji.  Euphrasie, along with her husband, provides for her family with its various needs.  She did not attend school.  To support herself, she has a business going door-to-door selling kitchen utensils (insulated containers, nested bowls, tubs, etc.)  Secondarily, she sells soaps.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She has been in this business for eight years and has already benefited from a loan from ALIDé that she has repaid.  Euphrasie is requesting a second loan to increase her inventory which will enable her to grow her sales. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying kitchen utensils and soaps

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 28 year old single man from Lebanon. Mohamad has been selling groceries from his van for a year now. He is a mobile grocery salesman. He travels in his town and meets with local community clients. His most popular products are snacks, juices and beverages, cigarettes, candies and chips.

Mohamad says that his experience in trading is why he decided on doing his job. When he first started, he encountered some financial issues and couldn't diversify his merchandise. Today, for the first time, he is asking for a loan to change his van, as he wants to have a bigger and better one for his work. He hopes that it will allow him to improve his financial situation. He hopes in the future, to improve his work.

loans.use: To change his van.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: Mrs. Sitha M. is a 42-year-old farmer who lives in Thkov village in Takeo province. She owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice and she is also a pig breeder and rice-wine maker at home. In order to support her pig breeding and rice wine making, Mrs. Sitha M. decided to ask for a loan to buy eight piglets and pig food, and to buy more rice for rice-wine making. Her husband, Mr. Sophai Mom, is a construction worker and also helps his wife's businesses. The couple has five children; one is car driver, three are students who also help support their parents' businesses, while the youngest one is five years old.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets and pig food for pig breeding

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em E., 53, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. E. sells Chinese noodles and porridge, earning an income of $5 US per day. Her husband is a barber and earns an income of $2 per day. 

E. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike for a child to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie R. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old and married with four adult. Virgie owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily-use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Virgie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Virgie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Our Father #3 Group

texts.en:
Famata T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Our Father #3. Famata is 37 years old, married and has five children who range from 3 to 18 years old. She cares for four siblings.

She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 12 years, she has been selling used clothes in the River View Community Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 7,500-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 37,500-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. She describes herself as earnest.

Her goals are to improve her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Math S. is a 30-year-old single man who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is an internal employee in a modern casino and is able to earn $330 a month. He started his job more than nine years ago. Math S. lives with his young brother who works in a private company. In the past, Math S. paid a lot of money to hire a taxi to travel to work because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. Math S. hopes to cut down on the cost of hiring taxis by using a loan he has requested to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Real's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan.  They all live in Preak Toch village, Kandal province.  Real T. is 49 years old and the group's leader.  Each member will use their portion of the loan to support different small businesses.
 
Real decided to ask for a loan to sell cooked rice and fast food.  With a new business, Real hopes to increase her income.  She is a widow with three children: two are laborers and the other attends school.

loans.use: Sell cooked rice and fast food.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina P. makes a living selling rice, seeds and other items, and is applying for this loan to buy bags of rice from Uganda to sell to her customers.  She is 33 years old, married to a driver, and has eight children, four of whom are currently in school. She plans to use the profits generated by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor Gutierrez, Sr. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 55 years old. Amor is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Amor owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Amor has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Amor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Amor is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Amor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa R. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Baybay Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 43 years old. Analisa is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Analisa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Analisa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Analisa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Analisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao C., 19, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. is a bartender, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband sells mobile phones, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Chanthou has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.  She is requesting a loan of USD 550 to purchase more phones to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

 C.'s husband appears in the photograph because C. was not available.

loans.use: buy more phones to resell

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: El Señor Hernan es propietario de una pulpería ubicada en su vivienda que es en la comarca del jicaral, cuenta con clientela formada, tiene una hermosa familia conformada por 15 hijos pero ya todos son mayores de edad. El inicio cuando su esposa falleció, ya que anteriormente ella tenía el negocio, con el paso del tiempo el negocio fue creciendo fue así que más tarde Herman opto por hacerse cargo del negocio con el  fin de proporcionar a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos. El Cliente manifiesta su satisfacción por trabajar y con el financiamiento comprara materia prima ya que se acercan buenas temporadas esto contribuirá por el apoyo, desarrollo y crecimiento para su actividad.
texts.en: Mr. Hernan owns a small grocery store that is located at his house which is in the Jicaral District. He has an established customer base. He has a beautiful family with fifteen children that are all grown-ups. He started this business after his wife died. Before she died she ran this business. As time passed, her business grew. This is why Hernan decided to take charge of the business. He would like to provide his customers with a greater variety of products. He enjoys working and with this loan he will buy wholesale goods as this will help with supporting, developing and growing his business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Kety

texts.es: Kety, de 25 años, convive con Huber, de 27 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Bryan, de 5, Cintia, de4 y Diana, de 10 meses de edad. En unión familiar, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Cauquiran. La siembra de papa, en todas sus variedades, es su principal actividad económica. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose al noble oficio de la agricultura. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder, sembrar una nueva variedad de papa, pues según afirma, cada siembra necesita otros cuidados. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Kety, ella también cría corderos, los cuales los engorda y los vende a un precio más alto del inicial en el mercado de su ciudad. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo, ella puede dinamizar sus ventas y sus ganancias. Por ello más adelante está pensando en mejorar su producción y comprar más cabezas de ganado. Este es el  tercer crédito con MFP, y como socia nueva de su banco comunal, está agradecida de la confianza que depositaron en ella. Con el monto que solicita comprará, 10 bolsas de abono orgánico, que esparcirá en su producción de papa, que en estos meses cosechará.
