texts.en: Kety, of 25 years old, lives with Huber, of 27 years old.  Both of them have 3 children: 5 year-old Bryan, 4 year-old Cintia, and 10 month old Diana.  They all live together as a family in their own house, located in the locality of Cauquiran.  They grow potatoes, in all of its varieties, as their main source of income.  She has been proudly working in agriculture for over 4 years.  What she enjoys most about her work is the ability to grow new varieties of potatoes, since every harvest requires specific care.  Kety does not only work in agriculture.  She also raises pigs, which she fattens and then sells at an elevated price at her local market.  Thanks to the support of her husband, she is able to diversify her sales and her earnings.  In the future, she is planning on improving her production and buying more animal stock.  This is her third credit with MFP, and as a new member of her communal bank, she is grateful for the confidence placed upon her.  With the loan that she is applying for, she will purchase 10 bags of organic fertiliser that she will use on her potato crops, which she will harvest in the next few months.

loans.use: Purchase 10 bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas esta formado por 11 mujeres, quienes luchan día a día en sus trabajos para mejorar la economía de sus hogares y así sacar adelante a sus hijos, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad  la tercera ciudad  más importante del país, su gente es amable y cordial quienes guardan sus tradiciones y cultura.

La Señora María H. vive por el sector de San Joaquín, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una muy buena amiga quien es socia del banco. Tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 11, 8, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora en una ferretería, con el sacrificio de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia. 
Doña María se dedica hace 3 años al  arreglo de oficinas y casas, esta actividad la realiza 4 días de la semana y no tiene un horario fijo. En su casa se dedica a la cría de animales como cerdos, gallinas y cuyes los que son para su consumo o cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica los vende. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento para iniciar con este negocio. Su meta es  tener un criadero de pollos muy grande.

La Señora. Marcia S. vive por el sector de la Feria Libre. Tiene 42 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 18, 16, 15 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo es especial y estudia en una escuela para niños especiales, su segunda y tercer hijo estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Marcia está en su tercer crédito y fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa del banco comunal. Nuestra socia se dedica a la atención de cabinas telefónicas e Internet, el local es de su propiedad, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de confitería para la venta en su local. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Progresistas” (Progressive Women) is made up of 11 women who daily fight in their jobs to improve their household economic situations and provide a future for their children. They live in different parts of Cuenca city, the third most important city in the country, whose people are friendly and cordial, keeping their traditions and culture.

Mrs. María H. lives in the San Joaquín area, this is her second loan from the communal bank and she was invited by a good friend who is a member of the bank. She is 28 years old, married, and has 4 children ages 11, 8, 5, and 3. Her first two children student in a school in the city, her husband works in a hardware store, and with sacrifice from their work they have been able to build their own home.

María has been cleaning offices and homes for 3 years, working 4 days a week and she doesn’t have a fixed schedule. At home she raises animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs for consumption or when needed, she sells them. The money from her loan will be invested in buying chickens and chicken feed to begin with this business. Her goal is to have a very large chicken farm.

Marcia S. lives in the Feria Libre area. She is 42 years old, a single mother of 4 children ages 18, 16, 15, and 2. Her oldest son is special and studies at a school for special children. Her second and third children study in one of the city’s schools. She doesn’t have her own home, she rents.
Marcia is in her third loan cycle and was invited by a friend who is a member of the communal bank. Our member has an Internet and telephone business located on her property. She works Sunday to Sunday from 8 in the morning until 1- at night. The money from her loan will be used to establish a snack shop at her locale. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: Buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Henrry Emilio

texts.es:
Henrry Emilio D. L. O. tiene 30 años D. edad, Es soltero vive solo  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos, No tiene hijos.

Los miembros D. la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas D. ciclo corto siembra D. maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Henrry Emilio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra D. maíz, arroz, cacao desD. hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  venD. en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra D. insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo D. maíz, arroz, Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir progresando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Henrry Emilio D. L. O. is 30 years old, he is single and he lives in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Rios province. He doesn't have children. 

The communal bank named "Jesus Loves Us" is located in the community of Los Amarillos in the city of Ventanas. This group is dedicated to short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice, and beans. They have practiced this business for a long time. 

Henrry Emilio is an agriculturist who has been sowing corn, rice, and cocoa for the past 5 years. He makes his purchases at Agripac Eicopa, and he carries out his sales in Ventanas. 

He requests a loan to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers that he needs to cultivate corn and rice. With this loan he will have the financial support to proviD. for his needs, and to face difficulties such as plagues, disease, and the changing weather. His dream is to develop his business. 

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products and fertilizers.

loans.name: Soda

texts.en:
Mr. Soda M. (in the photo), 29, and his wife, Mrs. Uheng Kourch, have been married since 2002 and have two daughters. One is in school and the other is still young. The family lives along National Road Number Six about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Soda is a driver, and is hired to drive. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is requesting his first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Union De Mujeres En Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Josefa es la coordinadora del grupo Union de mujeres en desarrollo, Grupo formado por 10 mujeres empresarias, dominico-haitianas de la ciudad de San Pedro de Macoris, viven en una comunidad de escasos recursos, rural bordeada por los campos de plantacion de caña de azucar. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de alimentos, comida, Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

Josefa, es una madre haitiana de 3 hijos, la cual ha emigrado a Republica Dominicana, con la esperanza de lograr un mejor futuro para ella y sus hijos; ha sido dificil establecerse, y formar un negocio, muchas veces por la falta de capital, da gracias a que el programa de Esperanza llego a su comunidad y va a poder invertir y mejorar en su negocio, por medio de este podra tambien ayudar y proveer sus necesidades y la de sus hijos. Sueña con regresar a Haiti y tener una vida estable y segura.

Josefa se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, esta recibiendo su primer prestamo con Esperanza y sus planes de inversion son cobrar todo su prestamo en mercancias para poder expandir sus clientes y poder expandirse.

Su historia representa a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la República Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la República Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Josefa is the coordinator of the "Unión de Mujeres en Desarrollo" (Union of Developing Women) group which is made up of 10 Dominico-Haitian businesswomen from the city of San Pedro de Macoris.  The women live in a poor, rural community which is surrounded by fields of sugar cane.  The women mainly work selling food, meals, clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics and other miscellaneous products. 

Josefa is a Haitian mother who has three children.  She emigrated to the Dominican Republic with the hope of achieving a better future for herself and her children.  It has been difficult for her to get established and set up a business, often owing to the lack of capital.  She is thankful that Esperanza's program reached her community and that she is going to be able to invest in and improve her business.  Through her business she will be able to cover her needs and those of her children.  She dreams of returning to Haiti and living a stable and safe life.

Josefa's business is selling underwear.  She is receiving her first loan from Esperanza and she plans to invest all her loan money in buying merchandise so that she can increase her number of customers and expand her business.

Josefa's story is representative of the other members of her group and Esperanza's clients in general, both the Haitians (many of whom have recently emigrated to the Domincan Republic from Haiti) and the Dominicans.  In general they live in very poor communities.  This area, in common with many other poor areas in the Dominican Republic, lacks reliable supplies of drinking water and electricity.

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  farming, livestock and a general store. Her husband Abraham, who is 53 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 23 and 32 years old. Gilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to fund the farm.  She makes an income from the sales of products from her farm.  She also has an inventory of livestock so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and expansion of her business. Gilda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

 About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To establish a pasture

loans.name: Julia Githinji

texts.en:
Julia has operated her Mpesa (money transfer service) in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. She is 32 years old and married to David Waweru. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and on time.  She plans to use the loan amount as deposit for Mpesa Float. In the future, Julia hopes to grow her money transfer service and open different outlets.

loans.use: To increase Mpesa float balance.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase used clothes to resell and to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en: Norayr B. lives in Ashotavan, a community in the Syunik region of Armenia. He is engaged in agriculture with his family. He has a small farm. Norayr has his own land where he plans to grow barley. Unfortunately, he isn’t able to develop a farm because of health problems, so he also wants to buy bee hives. Norayr expects to get more income by selling barley and honey  to meet his family’s daily needs. He doesn’t have sufficient funds, so he has applied to SEF to increase his income and to implement his plans.

loans.use: to pay for bee hives

loans.name: Abrewa

texts.en: Abrewa K. sells smoked fish in Eguafo near Elmina. She is married to a farmer. Abrewa has been selling smoked fish for seven years. She helps her husband with the payment of household expenditures. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to save the new profit towards the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn D. A. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a slippers retailing business in the Philippines. Jenelyn has been in this business for 12 years. She earns additional income from RTW (Ready-To-Wear) clothing.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more stock of slippers to sell in her stall.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocksof slippers to sell in her stall.
